title: Business Analyst - Communications and Education
job_description: Company DescriptionVisa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.Job DescriptionWe are actively seeking an Analyst to be a part of our Business Operations team within the Global Standards Management (GSM) division. The GSM team is responsible for the centralized governance and oversight of Visa’s current participation and engagement within Industry Standards-setting organizations, as well as in related industry trade associations. The team ensures standards participation, decisions, formal contributions, and general issue resolution aligns with Visa strategy.This pivotal role demands a professional who can adeptly integrate business analysis with communication initiatives, supporting Standards Management in collaboration with internal subject matter industry experts, cross-functional teams, and executive stakeholders. The successful candidate will partner with internal experts for trend analysis and information aggregation to generate insightful reports, educational webinars, and collaborative platforms (e.g., SharePoint site, Viva Engage) bringing visibility to relevant standards, interoperability, and potential impact – both internal and external. This individual will also be entrusted with establishing a document repository platform for efficient tracking and future use and championing the GSM brand within the organization.As a driven self-starter, the incumbent will be comfortable operating in an agile environment and possess the ability to independently drive initiatives to completion. The role also requires strong cross-functional collaboration and partnership skills. The ideal candidate will embrace accountability as described in Visa’s Leadership Principles and be committed to the mission of the GSM team.Role ResponsibilitiesCommunications, Education and Brand Visibility. Collaborate with standards experts and other internal stakeholders to generate detailed informative reports, including key highlights and trends analysis for executive leadership review. Generate detailed communications (e.g., Bi-Weekly Newsletter, Monthly and Quarterly Reports) to increase visibility of current work efforts, emerging standards, trends analysis, and implications to the business. Define, develop, and deliver on all initiatives related to transforming and enhancing communications, GSM collateral, reporting, education, and site maintenance engagement strategies. Delivery of informative analysis and complex ideas in presentation format succinctly and in an engaging manner. Partner with internal stakeholders (e.g., legal, IT, Visa University, Corporate Comms) to develop, design and deliver evolving comprehensive training initiatives and material for organization participants to enhance their competencies and understanding of engagement policies. Design, develop, and deliver evolving GSM playbook and talking points to institute supporting platforms for all audiences providing awareness to policies, procedures, and relevant material. Transform and manage a centralized document repository platform, ensuring efficient tracking, retrieval, and management of critical standards-related information. Serve as brand ambassador within Visa to boost visibility by advocating for the GSM brand using established networking platforms through the creation of engaging media content and sharing across multiple platforms (e.g., SharePoint site, LinkedIn, Viva Engage, Podcasts etc.). Contribute to all GSM strategy initiatives, framework, reporting, and governance models with a consistent rhythm. Collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to drive GSM and Visa communication, educational, and other similar objectives. Foster strong relationships within the organization, leveraging these relationships to influence decisions, drive change, and motivate cross-departmental partnership. All other duties as assigned. This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.QualificationsBasic Qualifications2 or more years of work experience with a bachelor’s degree or an Advanced Degree (e.g., Masters, MBA, JD, MD, or PhD). Preferred Qualifications3 or more years of work experience with a bachelor’s degree or more than 2 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g., Masters, MBA, JD, MD). Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in business strategy, management, communications, or related field. At least 3 years of experience in project management or similar roles is essential. Exceptional organizational, time management, program management and prioritization skills. Excellent business analysis, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with experience in developing compelling narratives and content. Excellent execution and project management skills, with experience in leading strategic and high-visibility initiatives. Excellent team collaboration and engagement skills. Aptitude for improving operations processes and participation governance functionality. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, demonstrating resilience and a proactive approach in responding to changing business needs and priorities. Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Power BI/Tableau/Jira or other project management tools is a plus. Experience in planning and delivering marketing and brand awareness activities is a plus. Passionate about our mission and values. Additional InformationWork Hours: Varies upon the needs of the department.Travel Requirements: This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.Mental/Physical Requirements: This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable local law, including the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.U.S. APPLICANTS ONLY: The estimated salary range for a new hire into this position is 83,300.00 to 117,750.00 USD per year, which may include potential sales incentive payments (if applicable). Salary may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. In addition, this position may be eligible for bonus and equity. Visa has a comprehensive benefits package for which this position may be eligible that includes Medical, Dental, Vision, 401 (k), FSA/HSA, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, and Wellness Program.

title: SQL Business Analyst
job_description: Job Description:        Responsibilities:      Under general supervision design, develop, implement SQL queries, and create custom reports to enhance organizational productivity.      Develop, implement, and optimize stored procedures and functions using T-SQL.     Create ad-hoc queries and reports as requested and provide ongoing analytical support.     Work with users to understand business processes, gather/document project requirements, and translate them into reports and applications.     Works on process flow and screen designs and provides storyboarding to support system design.      Review and interpret ongoing business report requirements.     Provide timely scheduled management reporting.     Thoroughly test solutions to ensure functionality and integrity.     Troubleshooting of third-party and custom software applications.     Help Desk support as needed to support production applications.      Qualifications:     Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, IT, MIS, Engineering, or related fields.     7+ years of experience as a SQL Developer or similar role.     Development of complex T-SQL queries and corresponding database objects.     Experience across the SDLC, including requirements, design, development, testing, documentation, training, deployment, operations, support, and maintenance.     Development experience in scripting using .Net or Java technologies.     Familiarity with code versioning tools, like Git, SVN, and TFS.     Excellent Linux/Unix command knowledge and cloud infrastructure (Amazon Web Services).     Ability to work well with business unit SMEs, Business Analysts, vendors, and end users in cross-functional teams.     Critical thinking and problem-solving skills.     Track record of meeting or exceeding client expectations, personal performance expectations, and achieving project goals.

Additionally, they should raise and report known or suspected violations to the appropriate Company authority in a timely fashion.Performs other related duties as required.The information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.Synovus is an Equal Opportunity Employer supporting diversity in the workplaceMinimum Education:Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, or a related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience.Minimum Experience:Three years of experience developing, implementing and maintaining enterprise policies, procedures and operating standards including preparing agendas, meeting minutes, and follow-up actions for meetings with management.Required Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:Knowledge of the industry's standard business practices, products, and servicesKnowledge of information system development strategiesSkill using tools such as SDLC, VISIOAnalytical, problem-solving and project management skillsAbility to effectively communicate across organizational layers verbally and in writingProficiency using Microsoft Office software productsPreferred Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:Experience in one or more Synovus lines of businessExperience with IT governance, project execution and IT planningKnowledge of project management tools, methods and best practices such as those defined by the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK).User level knowledge of SQL databases.Project management skills and the ability to multitask in a cross-functional environment.The ability to successfully manage the administration of one or more systems and/or applications

title: Business Analyst, AWS Marketing
job_description: DescriptionAmazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking an experienced, results-driven Business Analyst to own Website reporting, measurement, and analysis across the AWS website.As a Business Analyst for the AWS Marketing Website, you will play a leading role in identifying actionable insights for AWS marketers. You will have the opportunity to improve the website experience for our customers by creating a data-driven approach to measuring content quality, and partnering with Digital Specialists, SEO, Design, Product Managers and Marketers to develop, implement, and measure website initiatives.The AWS Website is complex. Although we do report weekly on common web KPIs such as traffic, engagement and conversion, as we evolve into a more journey focused and customer centric site, we must consider exploring non-standard KPIs. We are looking for a highly analytical person with enterprise level experience that identifies relevant website insights across a matrixed organization. A successful candidate will be an advocate for web analytics best practices and well-versed in what it takes to measure website performance for a multi-thousand page, high-traffic, global marketing website that is localized throughout the world. This role requires a proven track record in developing reporting, a deep understanding of web metrics and commonly used third-party platforms, analytical skills to identify risks and opportunities, and interpersonal and project management skills to harness the passion and energy of teams across AWS to deliver content to our customers.This role can be in Seattle, WA or Atlanta, GA. Amazon will offer relocation to anywhere with a corporate office in the United States.Key job responsibilities Working with AWT Digital Specialists, Marketers and our key marketing stakeholder teams to understand business goals, , and provide insights and reporting on how AWS customers engage with our marketing websites. Enhancing existing marketing measurement and design KPIs to best measure marketing effectiveness Investigating and conducting deep dives into data across the website and potentially other marketing channels (email, social, paid media, etc.) to understand customer engagement and analyze behaviors throughout the customer journey. Proactively explaining the ‘why’ in addition to the ‘what’ while educating business stakeholders on insights. Analyzing, tracking and reporting on overall site performance, using data to report out progress on key initiatives with insights that will shape future web content strategy. Creating reports and mechanisms to ensure AWS website content adheres to reporting and analytics best practices. Educating marketers and content authors on best practices for developing website KPIs and reporting. Maintaining documentation and articles that educate the organization on best practices for measuring website performance.Writing compelling narratives from data analysis to illuminate marketing impacts and customer behaviors, enhancing strategic decision-making and storytelling in marketing initiatives Tracking and analyzing key metrics like conversion, retention and CTAs including MQLs, SQLs, revenuenon-brand traffic and combined search (paid and organic) performance.About The TeamAWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.Diverse ExperiencesAmazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.Why AWSAmazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.Work/Life BalanceWe value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.Inclusive Team CultureHere at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.Mentorship and Career GrowthWe’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:Atlanta, GA, USA | Seattle, WA, USABasic Qualifications Experience using data and metrics to drive improvements Experience with Excel or Tableau (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables)Preferred Qualifications 3+ years Search Engine Optimization Analysis experienceAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $63,000/year in our lowest geographic market up to $151,700/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.Company - Amazon Web Services, Inc.Job ID: A2599926

title: Sr. Business Analyst
job_description: Georgia-Pacific (GP) is among the world's leading manufacturers of bath tissue, paper towels, napkins, tableware, paper-based packaging, office papers, cellulose, specialty fibers, nonwoven fabrics, building products and related chemicals. Our building products business makes DensGlass® gypsum board often seen in commercial construction, DryPly® plywood and RESI-MIX® wood adhesives, among others. Our containerboard and packaging business offers high-end graphic packaging to bulk bins as well as Golden Isles fluff pulp. You may also recognize consumer brands like Angel Soft®, Brawny®, and Dixie® on retail shelves and enMotion® towels, Compact® bath tissue and SmartStock® cutlery dispensers when you are away from home. Our GP Harmon business is one of the world's largest recyclers of paper, metal and plastics. As a Koch Company, we create long-term value using resources efficiently to provide innovative products and solutions that meet the needs of customers and society, while operating in a manner that is environmentally and socially responsible, and economically sound. Headquartered in Atlanta, GA., we employ approximately 35,000 people. For more information, visit www.gp.com.To learn more about our culture, Principle Based Management (PBM®), click here: https://principlebasedmanagement.com/booklet https://www.kochind.com/about/business-philosophyAs a business analyst, you will have the opportunity to take charge of the Plan to Make configurations, programs, and RICEFW elements. This may require leading meetings/workshops.Map prioritized requirements with application configuration (M3 and 3rd Party tools)Work with stake holders to document user acceptance criteria (functional and non-functional).In partnership with QA resources, develop test cases, execute test plans, log defects, develop functional design specifications including integrations, workflow, validation, and logic requirements. Ensure designs can be traced back to requirements.Analyze business challenges, objectives and develop as is/to-be processes.Assist in conducting research of software solutions (Built/Bought) to meet agreed upon requirements and to support purchasing efforts as needed.Assist support team when needed to aid in the closure of support topicsPerform impact analysis on monthly code changes from ERP vendorDevelop and maintain solid understanding of the Pulp & Paper industry.Develop and maintain subject matter expertise in Infor M3 and appropriate 3rd Party and custom software features, behavior and high-level architecture.Mentor Jr. level Business Analysts in support of their learning opportunitiesWilling to travel up to 25% to see mill operationsWho You Are (Basic Qualifications)Experience designing, supporting, and configuring Manufacturing and/or Planning functions and integrations in an ERP.At least 3 years' experience as a Business AnalystExperience conducting and leading discovery workshops, design, and configurationsWhat Will Put You AheadExperience with Infor M3 Multitenant ERPExperience in Pulp and Paper industry.Experience as a lead analyst in a cross functional environmentExperience integrating with manufacturing execution systems (MES) or ERP systemsWorking Knowledge of Agile/SDLC development methodologies.Bachelor's or higher in Computer Science or equivalent OR equivalent M3 Certifications.At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate's knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy.Hiring PhilosophyAll Koch companies value diversity of thought, perspectives, aptitudes, experiences, and backgrounds. We are Military Ready and Second Chance employers. Learn more about our hiring philosophy here.Who We AreAs a Koch company and a leading manufacturer of bath tissue, paper towels, paper-based packaging, cellulose, specialty fibers, building products and much more, Georgia-Pacific works to meet evolving needs of customers worldwide with quality products. In addition to the products we make, we operate one of the largest recycling businesses. Our more than 30,000 employees in over 150 locations are empowered to innovate every day – to make everyday products even better.At Koch, employees are empowered to do what they do best to make life better. Learn how our business philosophy helps employees unleash their potential while creating value for themselves and the company.Our BenefitsOur goal is for each employee, and their families, to live fulfilling and healthy lives. We provide essential resources and support to build and maintain physical, financial, and emotional strength - focusing on overall wellbeing so you can focus on what matters most. Our benefits plan includes - medical, dental, vision, flexible spending and health savings accounts, life insurance, ADD, disability, retirement, paid vacation/time off, educational assistance, and may also include infertility assistance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Specific eligibility criteria is set by the applicable Summary Plan Description, policy or guideline and benefits may vary by geographic region. If you have questions on what benefits apply to you, please speak to your recruiter.Additionally, everyone has individual work and personal needs. We seek to enable the best work environment that helps you and the business work together to produce superior results.Equal OpportunitiesEqual Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status. title: Business Analyst
job_description: Transwestern Real Estate Services adds value for investors, owners and occupiers of all commercial property types through comprehensive solutions grounded in sound market intelligence. Part of the Transwestern companies, the firm applies a consultative approach to Agency Leasing, Asset Services, Tenant Advisory + Workplace Soluitons, Capital Markets and Research & Investment Analytics.Our firm’s award-winning culture and reputation for exceptional service are built on a common purpose – Empowering Good People to do Extraordinary Things Together. This unique approach, reinforced by the hiring of smart, passionate, hard-working people who understand the benefits of both collaboration and independence, create value for our team members and clients every day.The Business Analyst will perform real estate analytics services in support of servicing portfolios of properties on behalf of clients involving acquisition and/or disposition of space on behalf of clients. The Business Analyst will assist with the development of business opportunities by generating leads, cultivating client relationships, and managing and closing commercial real estate transactions. The Business Analyst will conduct property tours, perform financial analysis, and prepare client reports and pitches/proposals.Essential Job FunctionsWork with senior brokers to assist in calls and business development activities through prospecting, networking, relationship building, marketing and client presentations.Provide clients with pertinent information on leasing availability, current market conditions, and financial analyses to assist in the decision-making process.Accompany prospective clients to property tours to discuss property features, leasing rates, and terms.Compile property data for clients, such as summary reports, maps, status updates, and industry/market-specific information.Prepare Request for Proposals (RFP) and review RFP responses.Analyze data and prepare real estate reports on average asking rents, tenants in the market, historical data, and market comparisons.Report and update senior brokers on potential deals being generated, issues/concerns, and next steps.Participate in contract negotiations and due diligence.Draft correspondence to existing and prospective clients.Gather, prepare, and distributes marketing materials.Engage in the local community and charitable events, as well as industry and professional associations for the purpose of creating new contacts and generating new business.Maintain client list and deals within the company’s CRM system.Position RequirementsA bachelor’s degree with emphasis in real estate, accounting, finance, or related field.A real estate license within state and maintained in good standing throughout employment.Internship experience in Commercial Real Estate a plus.2+ years of work experience in Finance, Real Estate or Accounting preferred.Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, and Adobe.Knowledge of CoStar and other related CRE listing software a plus.Knowledge of ESRI suite, GIS, Tableau, Power BI, Argus, Asana, Google suite, decision science tools and stochastic modeling (Palisades suite, Python, R) and other business platforms a plus.Strong organizational, visualization, communication, and analytical skills.Demonstrated writing skills; ability to write concisely and effectively.Ability to create, articulate and effectively present information.Must listen actively and attentively, capturing accurately and completely relevant and valuable information.Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret complex documents.Ability to effectively present information.Able to track and support concurrent real estate projects at different stages and utilize a project management platform regularly.Aptitude for sales prospecting through a variety of techniques including telephone and in person.Ability to provide general direction/be self-managed/work independently.Willingness to work hard in a transaction‐oriented environment and to take ownership of project outcomes.Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable, and courteous service to internal and external clients.Ability to keep information and internal communications confidential.Exhibit excellent verbal and written communication skills. Travel may be required.WORK SHIFTLOCATIONAtlanta, GAWe Are Transwestern!Transwestern's Guiding Principles are woven into the fabric of our firm and underscore the value of each individual team member. We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion — not only as the right thing to do, but as a reflection of who we are. It is our responsibility and heartfelt desire to create an environment that elevates the human spirit and brings out the best in everyone. Transwestern offers an exciting work environment, competitive salary and excellent benefits, which include medical, dental and vision coverage, as well as a 401(K) plan. Transwestern is an Equal Opportunity Employer.Third Party Agencies/Vendors!Transwestern recognizes the valued service provided by its recruitment agencies and as such have a Preferred Supplier List, which whom terms of business have been agreed. Only suppliers who have signed these terms can engage with Transwestern and its Family of Companies. If you are interested in becoming a Preferred Supplier vendor, we invite you to email us only at recruittw@transwestern.com. Please provide relevant information about your agency, and our dedicated team will carefully review and approve your submission. We will reach out if we find that there is a potential match and interest in adding your agency to our preapproved recruiting vendors list. Agreements obtained outside of this formal process will not be recognized and will be deemed invalid. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation in adhering to this established procedure. Thank you in advance.

title: Lead Business Analyst
job_description: OverviewJob PurposeICE Data Analytics, LLC (a subsidiary of Intercontinental Exchange, Inc.) is looking for a Lead Business Analyst to be part of the technology organization based in our Atlanta office. The Lead Business Analyst will collaborate with cross-functional ICE Data Analytics Products, Engineering, Data Operations, Quantitative and QA teams to perform analysis for development of tools and reports as they relate to the Fixed Income Analytics in order to achieve key management objectives. The Lead Business Analyst analyzes users' business needs for to develop effective and creative solutions within time constraints using but not limited to SQL, Visio and Programming technologies. Further, the Lead Business Analyst will manage all phases of the project life-cycle including providing input to parts of technical specs and developing requirements, design, test plans and production release artifacts.ResponsibilitiesPrior experience in business analysis and worked as a liaison between Business and Technology teams as part of the SDLC processExperience working within an integrated technology environment – using relational databases, end-points/APIs and UIs to read and analyze data. title: Product Analyst
job_description: At Aline, we are committed to revolutionizing the senior living management technology market by continuously elevating our offerings and ensuring exceptional user experiences. In line with this commitment, we are seeking a dedicated Product Analyst to join our vibrant team. This role is designed for a dynamic individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is passionate about making a tangible impact through our products and services. The Product Analyst is crucial in driving our product development and project management efforts, offering extensive support across the entire product lifecycle. From requirements gathering to implementation and beyond, this role demands a blend of technical acumen, customer-centric focus, and innovative thinking. Join us in our mission to enhance the lives of seniors and their caregivers by delivering cutting-edge solutions and fostering meaningful engagements.The Product Analyst plays a pivotal role within the organization by offering comprehensive product and project support, facilitating client coordination, and providing invaluable subject matter expertise. Engaged throughout the entire product life cycle, this individual contributes to key phases including requirements gathering, testing, implementation, and ongoing support.ResponsibilitiesGather and analyze user requirements, business needs, and technical specifications to understand the scope and objectives of software products.Collaborate with stakeholders to define product features, functionalities, and priorities.Conduct market research to identify trends, competitive landscape, and user preferences.Work closely with UX designers to create intuitive and user-friendly software interfaces.Document detailed functional requirements, use cases, and user stories.Partner with stakeholder groups to understand business needs and identify new solutions for improving business processes.Prepare user manuals, release notes, and other documentation to support product deployment and usage.Perform application troubleshooting and problem-solving.Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) such as user adoption, utilization of new features, and revenue-driven metrics.Evaluate feedback from users, stakeholders, and internal teams to identify areas for product enhancement.Complete user acceptance and stress testing on new product features & functionality.Support the Implementation Team with new customer onboarding.May perform other duties as needed and/or assigned. RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field. Equivalent experience will be considered.Minimum of three (3) years of experience as a Product Analyst, Business Analyst, or similar role, preferably within a software development or technology-driven environment.Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and other relevant productivity tools.Exceptional customer service skills with a focus on understanding and addressing user needs.Strong analytical abilities with the capability to prioritize tasks, plan effectively, and solve complex problems.Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.Demonstrated time management and prioritization skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and adapt to changing priorities in a dynamic environment.Strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality results.Ability to work independently with minimal supervision while also functioning well within a team environment.Familiarity with SQL Server Management Studio or other database management tools is a plus.Experience working in Agile methodologies, including Scrum or Kanban.Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO®) is a plus.Experience working with JIRA is a plus.Apply Now

title: Sr. Analyst, Strategic Business Development (Corporate Strategy and M&A)
job_description: Req115001Position PurposeThe Home Depot ("THD") is redefining the future of retail. As the 4th largest retailer and 7th largest ecommerce retailer in the US, we have been named one of the world's most innovative companies and are on a mission to meld our 2,200+ stores, 400k+ associates, dozens of unique services, and award-winning website to enable "doers" of all types, whatever the job is at hand. The Strategic Business Development ("SBD") team helps lead the charge, working with business partners to both develop and execute THD's corporate strategy.SBD starts the process by leading THD's annual strategic planning efforts to identify the most critical focus areas for the next 1-3 years and, based on those focus areas, works with business leaders to determine the optimal mix of tactics to advance that strategy. With the strategy defined, SBD heavily supports key organic growth initiatives (via research, planning and implementation) and oversees all aspects of inorganic growth (i.e., partnership development, corporate investment, mergers and acquisitions). As part of SBD, team members will deepen their knowledge of retail generally and home improvement specifically, investigate emerging technologies influencing retail, and explore various retail functional strategies (i.e., customer in-store and online experience, merchandising, pricing, delivery, marketing, etc.).The Sr. Analyst role is a key member of the SBD team. The Sr. Analyst takes ownership of and drives the research, financial modeling and valuation, materials creation, and project management that are critical to defining and executing THD's strategy. In this role, the Sr. Analyst receives exposure to the whole THD business and has the opportunity to affect change from within one of the world's leading retailers.Key Responsibilities40% Corporate Strategy Formulation:Conduct specialized research, interviews, and analysis to evaluate market landscapes, competitors, and current business strategiesSupport annual enterprise strategic planning process40% Organic Initiative Execution:Support cross-functional project teams to manage and execute high-value initiativesSupport special projects and requests for the board of directors, c-suite, and executive and senior leadership teams20% Inorganic Growth:Target, evaluate, and maintain a pipeline of M&A / partnership / minority investment opportunitiesPerform financial analysis, valuation, and process management to enable deal executionExecute post-merger integration efforts with acquired businessesDirect Manager/Direct ReportsReports to a Director.Travel RequirementsTypically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.Physical RequirementsMost of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.Working ConditionsLocated in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.Minimum QualificationsMust be eighteen years of age or older.Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.Preferred Qualifications3 to 4 years of prior experience in strategy consulting, investment banking, private equity, corporate strategy, or corporate developmentExperience in the application of research findings to the retail environmentHistory of promotion / advancement ahead of status quoMinimum EducationThe knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job.Preferred EducationNo additional educationMinimum Years Of Work Experience3

title: Business Analyst - Albany, GA New
job_description: About This PositionAnalyst (Retail Maintenance, Retail Sourcing, Business Analyst)Professional Analysis, Inc. (PAI) is seeking a Professional Analyst for assistance with Retail Maintenance, Retail Sourcing and Business Analytics for Marine Corps Equipment. This position provides analytics support of Marine Corps Logistics Command requirements in Albany, GA. Work must be performed on site in Albany, GA.PAI is a Veteran Owned Small Business focused on providing genuine value to our customers by solving their logistics challenges in a way that maximizes resources while minimizing operational impacts. We are a fast-growing company with operations in over a dozen states and ten foreign countries. Over 65% of our workforce are veterans who are proud to continue their support to our country.Job Function And Duties Analyze supply chain processes and provide recommended courses of action for improvement. Provide analysis and information that is used by the government customer in retail maintenance and sourcing decisions. Apply knowledge of laws, policies, regulations and precedents applicable to logistics planning and program execution/sustainment. Develop recommendations for changes to Marine Corps policy. Develop briefings, documents, summaries and other communications related to improvement of SECREP supply chain processes. Develop responses to data calls in support of government customer requirements. Any additional items that are typical of or related to the work of a CSM Principal Analyst.Experience, Capabilities, And Qualifications Minimum of three to five (3-5) years working with Military wholesale and retail logistics activities in Reparable/Consumable support. Minimum of three to five (3-5) years in management of Ground Equipment Secondary Items. Minimum of three to five (3-5) years planning and executing in Metrics Management, SECREP sourcing, Source of Repair processes; and SECREP Wholesale Pricing. Minimum of one to two (1-2) years of performance management framework for evaluating the effectiveness of Products & ServicesCapabilities Apply relative knowledge to analyze problems to identify significant factors, gather pertinent data, and recognize and apply solutions Plan and organize work to successfully perform complex tasks Effectively and efficiently communicate, written and orally, to personnel at various status and rank Apply knowledge of the administrative processes and documentation requirements to logistics program execution and sustainmentQualifications Minimum of a four (4) year course of study in a relevant field leading to a bachelor’s degree, or a combination of successfully completed post-high school education and/or training experiences that meet the total qualification requirements for this position level Ability to obtain SECRET Level Security Clearance by Day 1 Ready (Retail Maintenance Analyst and Business Analyst) Must be physically located in/around Albany, GA.BenefitsProfessional development opportunities in a fast growing companyFull health insurance benefits packageTuition reimbursement plan availableGenerous Federal holiday schedulePaid personal time offPaid sick leave401KTo apply for this position, please send an email with a brief summary about yourself, salary requirements, and resume attached to careers@pai-inc.com.You are invited to voluntarily self-identify with respect to demographic information at the following link:https://eform.pandadoc.com/?eform=316f794d-0277-4afb-ac2e-417a5827a9fdHow To ApplyTo apply for this position, please send an email with a brief summary about yourself, salary requirements, and resume attached tocareers@pai-inc.com .You are invited to click here to voluntarily self-identify with respect to demographic information.Apply for this Position

title: Business Process Analyst - III (1042074)
job_description: Location:  Alpharetta, GASalary:  NegotiableDescriptionLocations: NJ, Tampa, Irvine CA, and Irving TX, Alpharetta, GACurrent Hybrid Schedule: In-office requirement is 3rd Wednesday each monthWhat You’ll Be Doing...The Data & Analytics Hub team is part of the Company Consumer Groups organization. As part of the Data & Analytics Hub team, you will be helping to create and deliver comprehensive tracking and measurement of the digital Company Consumer Group channel. In this role, you will develop and implement advanced reports and dashboard solutions to support business objectives. You will analyze data, clearly communicate findings, collaborate with stakeholders, and interact with cross functional teams to bring new experiences to life for our Customers. The successful candidate will help lead measurement implementations across cross-functional teams as they plan, build, and launch world-class experiences. You will help translate raw data into actionable insights and better experiences for our customers. Your deep knowledge of measurement solutions will help to determine the best approaches for implementations that best meet business needs. Extracts data points based on requirements while working with Development and Operations Teams to fulfill product reporting from launch Leads the development and implementation of advanced reports and dashboard solutions to support business objectives Analyzes data and clearly communicates findings to stakeholders Collaborates with stakeholders on reports and dashboardsWhat We’re Looking For…You are good with numbers, and you love to dig into data to find the story. Crafting reports and dashboards is a fun afternoon for you. You’re able to translate numbers into compelling stories and tailor your presentation and recommendations to the audience’s function and level to meet their needs. You are detail-oriented and know how to be passionate about what really matters. You have a knack for understanding and visualizing just the right way to share data and practical insights so that people can understand. You enjoy aligning various work streams to ensure the same vision and goal is achieved.You’ll Need To Have Bachelor’s degree in Math, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, Business Analytics, a related field, or four or more years work experience. Four or more years of relevant work experience. Experience with Adobe Analytics or related platform (ex. Google Analytics), or experience with tagging implementation. Ability to write SQL queries and scripts using relational databases like Teradata, Oracle, SQL Server and pulling data from Hadoop/HIVE SQL/EDW data warehouses. Data visualization skills and hands-on experience using Tableau and/or Qlik with SQL skills. Even better if you have one or more of the following:  Master’s degree or PhD in Math, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Science, or a related field. Experience developing general reporting, KPIs, metrics, and attributes. Strong verbal and written communication and storytelling skills. Strong problem solving, analytical, and research capabilities. Experience managing time-bound project deliverables for multiple stakeholders. Coding experience (e.g., Python, Java, C/C++).Contact: vbhardwaj@judge.comThis job and many more are available through The Judge Group. Find us on the web at www.judge.com

title: Senior Business Analyst, Finance (Onsite)
job_description: About UsAre you ready to join a community leading in innovative teaching and learning? Kennesaw State University is one of the 50 largest public institutions in the country. With our growing enrollment and global reach, we are enjoying increased prominence among Georgia's colleges. We offer more than 150 undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral degrees to over 43,000 students. Our entrepreneurial spirit, high-impact research, and Division I athletics also draw students from throughout the region and from 92 countries across the globe. Our university's vibrant culture, career opportunities, mission and values and rich benefits make us an employer of choice. We are part of the University System of Georgia. Kennesaw State will exemplify the power and promise of a student-centered, research-driven university. Our institutional values are student-inspired, promise-fulfilling, true to ourselves, elevational, open and impact-generating. In addition, we support the University System of Georgia core values of accountability, excellence, integrity and respect. We are searching for talented people to join Kennesaw State University. title: Business Process Analyst, FIS University Program
job_description: Position TypeFull timeType Of HireAssociate Development Program (Full Time Hire)Education DesiredBachelor's DegreeTravel Percentage0%Job DescriptionAre you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS, you will have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all, fun.Join the 2024 FIS University Program!As a 2024 FIS University Program full-time employee, you will have the opportunity to participate in team projects, community service activities, professional development seminars and work with a team that is invested in your growth, development, and success; including bi-annual performance connects with your manager.This Two-year Full-time Program Has Start Dates In January, March, June, And September With a Dedicated “Learning Week” Where You WillLearn how to work within a corporate environmentLearn about the exciting world of Fintech and the role FIS playsHear from FIS leadership about their journey and participate in senior leader networking opportunitiesBuild a network of your peers from across the organizationThis position is for a June 24, 2024 start.About The TeamFIS Loyalty delivers and supports engagement solutions to a broad customer base. Our flagship products support financial card loyalty programs and our Points as Currency Premium Payback product is leading the way to bring merchants and banks together and expand card reward benefits real-time where consumers shop and interact. As a Loyalty Business Process Analyst, you’ll work with our team of Product Managers developing the processes, artifacts and integration points to support our consumer redemption marketplace as well as our API services for our BaaS and CaaS products. You’ll be on the cutting edge of using Non-Fungible Tokens to enable exclusive redemption experiences connecting with state-of-the-art providers. You will help create the framework from which our next gen products will be developed. Working together with our technology and platform owners, this position sits at the crossroads of every interaction including customer apps. You’ll work as part of a team in a scrum setting and must be a self-motivated, proactive, and out-of-the-box thinker. We are passionate about our work and take a client-first approach to everything we do and our team is laser focused on delivering results.What You Will Be DoingDiagrams and evaluates existing processes and drives efficiencies within those processesHelps define improvements in solution design, analysis and testing activitiesResponsible for complex business and systems process analysis, design and simulationDevelops metrics that provide data for process measurement, identifying indicators for future improvement opportunitiesMeasures performance against process requirementsWhat You BringBachelor’s degree in relevant field of studyProficiency in Microsoft Office SuiteFluent in English; Strong written and verbal communication skillsAdaptability, a drive to learn, and strong problem-solving skillsAbility to work well independently and within a teamBonus if you haveProficiency with VisioUnderstanding of consumer rewards programs, specifically bank card rewardsWhat We Offer YouCompetitive salary and excellent benefitsThe chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services & technologyA broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities – FIS is your final career step!Time to support charities and give back to your communityA work environment built on collaboration, flexibility, and respectStudent Loan Repayment Program~ FIS will PAY OFF participants’ undergraduate loan balance over 10 years of service! Eligibility starts after one year of tenure in the program. The benefit applied to undergraduate student loans for US-based degrees and must be in the employee’s name. Current and future sponsorship are not available for this position*#FISUJUNE2024Privacy StatementFIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice .EEOC StatementFIS is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster is available here supplement document available hereFor positions located in the US, the following conditions apply. If you are made a conditional offer of employment, you will be required to undergo a drug test. ADA Disclaimer~ In developing this job description care was taken to include all competencies needed to successfully perform in this position. However, for Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) purposes, the essential functions of the job may or may not have been described for purposes of ADA reasonable accommodation. All reasonable accommodation requests will be reviewed and evaluated on a case-by-case basis.Sourcing ModelRecruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.#pridepass

title: Business Support Analyst Associate - Maast
job_description: Job SummaryWorks with internal and external business partners within the business function to align solutions with business strategies in the embedded finance sector. Identifies and communicates business needs and translates these needs into understandable requirements. Determines if internal or external solutions exist or whether new solutions are needed. Works with key technology and/or department analysts to determine if these solutions impact existing work processes and systems. Partners with appropriate resources to accurately prioritize, analyze, and document business processes. Provides input surrounding buy vs. build decisions for possible solutions. Identifies opportunities for improvement/enhancement, and negotiate agreements and commitments between business partners and IT from requirements gathering to the final implementation. Supports the Program and Partner Implementation teams with the execution of project and product development activities, contributing to working sessions, assisting with the coordination of cross-domain activities, among other project and product development tasks. Responsible for moderately complex work and assignments typically required of a business analyst.Job Duties And ResponsibilitiesResponsible for business administrative support to include business event planning, coordination of travel and other business support needs as required.Learns the business units supported to become an expert, as well as, an understanding of the IT and Operations capabilities. Supports and contributes to development of business strategy as a subject-matter-expert.Builds, maintains, and manages stakeholder relationships. Educates the IT and Operations organization on the direction of the business.Analyzes business partner's operations to understand strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to innovate and improve the customer experience. Understands and develops appropriate business models to represent business requirements and meet business needs. Understands the difference between a requirement and a desire or want.Develops business models to represent requirements, such as use cases, business process flows, and data flow diagrams.Obtains, captures, and validates needed information from stakeholders to form requirements through various analysis techniques. Responsible for requirements management, approval, change, and traceability.Participates in negotiation of agreements and commitments. Facilitates communication between business units and IT from initial requirements to final implementation. May make recommendations for buy versus build decisions.Maintains a current knowledge base and understanding of business industry trends. Leverages IT and corporate function partnerships to bring solutions to business units supported and enhance the enterprise's competitive edge. Contributes to business ideation and concept development as required.Works on multiple projects as a project team member. Evaluates and identifies project complexity, assumptions, constraints, and dependencies.Participates in planning sessions with business units to improve business processes. Understands, documents and contributes to continuous improvement of business/IT value streams. Acts as a value stream subject-matter-expert to IT and the business.Each team member is expected to be aware of risk within their functional area. This includes observing all policies, procedures, laws, regulations and risk limits specific to their role. Additionally, they should raise and report known or suspected violations to the appropriate Company authority in a timely fashion.Performs other related duties as required.The information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.Synovus is an Equal Opportunity Employer supporting diversity in the workplaceMinimum Education:Bachelor's degree with a focus on Economics, Finance, Communications, Computer Science, information Systems or an equivalent combination of education and experience.Minimum experience:Three (3) years of work related experience within the financial services industry.Required Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:Knowledge of the embedded finance, payments and or banking business practices, products, and servicesAdvanced knowledge of project delivery methodologies and processesHighly independent in thinking and framing problemsExceptional verbal and written communication skillsExceptional analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual skillsHighly proficient in MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, VisioStrong teamwork and interpersonal skills at all levels of management.Ability to blend creativity, problem solving, and technical skills for refining existing theories or developing new approaches.Ability to present and explain technical information in a way that establishes rapport, persuades others, and gains understanding.Ability to communicate needs and schedules to IT and clientsAbility to establish and maintain a high level of customer trust and confidence.Preferred Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:Financial Sector and payments experienceAgile certifications (CSM, CSPO, SAFe)Certified Business Analysis professional or other relevant industry designation

title: Senior Product Analyst
job_description: About GoBook.meGoBook.me is dedicated to building an ecosystem that empowers entrepreneurs to thrive. We provide small business owners with a suite of business management tools such as booking and scheduling, marketing, analytics, payment processing, and more.With a rapidly growing user base of small business owners relying on GoBook.me daily, our platform combines powerful functionality with a vibrant brand, making us a unique blend of fintech, SMB software, and consumer services.About The RoleAs a Senior Product Analyst at GoBook.me, you will play a crucial role in shaping our product roadmap and the future of our company by uncovering and sharing valuable insights. Collaborating with leaders across Product, Design, Analytics Engineering, Data Engineering, and the Go-to-Market team, you will work to enhance our product data infrastructure, develop analytical frameworks, and expand our analytical tools for more data-driven decision-making.We are currently seeking Analysts to join our Booking and Teams product teams. The Booking Product Analyst will focus on enhancing conversion rates on customer booking sites and improving operational efficiency in client management. The Teams Product Analyst will contribute to the acceleration of our up-market strategy.This position reports to the Manager of Product Analytics and offers the flexibility to work remotely from anywhere in United States.What You'll Do Define, analyze, and promote KPIs for your assigned product team Identify opportunities to enhance the customer experience, increase conversion, retention, engagement, and lifetime value through data analysis and a deep understanding of our customers Collaborate with the Product Management Lead to shape the product roadmap Work with Data Engineering and fellow Analytics teams to implement top-notch analytical frameworks and testing structures throughout the product What We're Looking For 4+ years of experience in an analytical role, with at least 2 years in product analytics, preferably in a SaaS company Advanced proficiency in SQL A proactive individual with excellent communication and project management skills Enthusiasm for working in a fast-paced startup environment and the willingness to engage in foundational work Proficiency with tools like dbt, Looker, or other data visualization tools, along with a solid grasp of statistical fundamentals (A/B testing, regression) Familiarity with leading product analytics tech stacks such as Mixpanel and Segment (or similar tools) is advantageous Benefits & Perks Flexible PTO Competitive health & dental insurance options, with premiums covered by GoBook.me Generous fully-paid parental leave policy Retirement Savings Plan Professional Development stipend for approved learning and educational expenses Home office support Team Bonding opportunities to foster meaningful connections within our distributed team At GoBook.me, we value diversity and are dedicated to creating a supportive workplace where all employees can excel. We believe that this not only benefits our team but also enhances our products, serves our customers better, and strengthens our community. GoBook.me is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.

title: Sr. Analyst, Loyalty Strategy
job_description: Req114792Position PurposeThe Senior Analyst, Loyalty Strategy – Benefit and Engagement Management will be responsible for helping drive innovative and elevated member experiences for The Home Depot’s Loyalty programs. The role will be responsible for tracking and analyzing customer feedback and engagement trends to inform the optimization of our loyalty program benefits and member experience. This role requires a data-driven analyst with a keen eye for detail and a passion for delivering exceptional customer experiences.Key Focus Areas Include− Track and analyze customer feedback, trends and program performance to identify opportunities for experience and benefit optimization− Monitor industry trends and best practices to inform benefit strategy− Serve as strategic thought partner and will operate as a customer advocate by providing a voice for the customer− Develop and maintain comprehensive reporting to track key engagement metrics and provide actionable insights to stakeholders− Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and track progress against OKRs− Deliver effective data storytelling to drive actionAn ideal candidate will have a proven track record analyzing customer data, tracking behavior patterns and quantifying subjective data to make recommendations that improve performance and customer satisfaction.Key Responsibilities50% Lead all phases of a project's life cycle including defining the business need, establishing criteria and business requirements, understanding the impact to the business and designing and rolling out the project25% Serve as a subject matter expert and perform research and/or analysis within assigned projects or category of business25% Establish and report on metrics of assigned projects or categories to gauge business valueDirect Manager/Direct ReportsReports to Sr. ManagerTravel RequirementsTypically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.Physical RequirementsMost of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.Working ConditionsLocated in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.Minimum QualificationsMust be eighteen years of age or older.Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.Preferred QualificationsPrior experience in the application of research findings to the retail environment, brand management or category management essentialExtensive knowledge of statistical methods and modelingPrior experience in a consulting and/or project management role within a corporate environment preferred.Certified Project Management Professional (PMP)Minimum EducationThe knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job.Preferred EducationNo additional educationMinimum Years Of Work Experience3Preferred Years Of Work ExperienceNo additional years of experienceMinimum Leadership ExperienceNonePreferred Leadership ExperienceNoneCertificationsNoneCompetenciesStrong project management skills, including strong process orientation, ability to work and lead cross functional teams, strategic thinking and creative problem solving skills.Analytical; Extensive knowledge of statistical methods and modelingAbility to establish priorities and procedures for accomplishing work within established deadlines; ability to lead multiple projects and manage toward deadlines and deliverablesStrong communication and presentation skills, including ability to interact at Officer level; ability to negotiate and persuadeProven success in increasing management roles handling multiple projects with competing deadlines.Ability to assimilate extensive amounts of detailed data, analyze and summarize vast amounts of information as well as understand all of the detail supporting the analysis.

title: Business Development Analyst
job_description: Peachtree Group is seeking a Business Development Associate to join the Commercial PACE Lending Team.Peachtree Group is an investment firm with a diverse portfolio of commercial real estate assets. We focus on real estate acquisition, development, and lending, and manage over $2.5 billion in equity. Our services are designed to protect, support, and grow our investments.The Business Development Associate will support Peachtree Credit’s CPACE efforts to become a leading CPACE provider by expanding the origination platform through outbound communication and lead generation. The position requires strong written and verbal communication, as well as excellent interpersonal and time management skills.Duties And FunctionsDriving outreach and contacting target companies to generate meetings with deal team membersIndependently run introduction and discovery callsTracking, reporting, and pipeline management in CRMWeekly outbound communication (call and email) to private company ownersCollaborate with marketing, originations, and closing teamWork with Marketing to leverage content and cultivate and convert leadsPartner with originations team to create and implement strategic and tactical outreachKeep on top of current industry and competitive trendsUnderstand CPACE legislation, program metrics, and maintain constant communication with CPACE administrators.Prepare quote & term sheets for early-stage deals and assist with presentation materials when needed.Build and maintain a series of relationships with business owners and managementParticipate in internal and external meetings with an eye toward identifying and understanding key themes, highlighting areas for follow-up and observing different presentation styles.Assist in investment team in ad-hoc sourcing activities or duties.The Ideal CandidateBachelor’s degree in Business or related fieldReal estate finance or CPACE experience a plus Self-starter with highly resourceful networking and prospecting skillsSense of urgency and ability to manage time and prioritize tasksStrong attention to detail and exceptional organizational skillsExcellent interpersonal, presentation, and written communication skillsAbility to work independently and collaborate with a teamComfortable interacting with senior executives

title: Senior Analyst, Optimization
job_description: United States, Georgia, AtlantaEnterprise Digital Strategy 14-Mar-2024Ref #: 23993How you'll help us Keep Climbing (overview & key responsibilities)At Delta Air Lines, we create world-class digital experiences that are customer-focused, innovative, easy to use and revenue-enhancing. The Digital Optimization team plays a critical role in Delta Air Lines’ Enterprise Digital Strategy team. As an Optimization Analyst, you will harness the power of online experimentation to glean critical insights that shape the way our customers shop, book and interact with content on our digital channels. By leveraging both your creative and analytical skillset, the team member will work to help foster a culture of creativity and testing, working closely with Digital teams and Optimization team to assess our test backlog, and work to develop, launch, and measure performance of optimization tests. Many of the tests will ultimately drive investment in IT development – implementing changes based on learnings from winning tests.Responsibilities:Design and deploy A/B tests to learn more about our customers and improve the Delta.com ecosystemMaintain relationships with digital product teams (Search and Purchase, Digital Loyalty, Trip Management, Digital Self Service and others) and other stakeholders to stay abreast of business developments and industry trends in order to drive a robust backlog of ideasWork with the Digital Tools team, various product teams, and Analytics teams to guide ideas from ideation through technical/design/analytic assessmentsIdentify success metrics and design test analytics planSocialize backlog and ensure alignment regarding testing prioritiesPartner with all stakeholders to gain approvals, perform QA testing, and launch testsUtilize Adobe Analytics, Quantum Metric to assess and monitor performance of testsCommunicate test results to stakeholders and digital leadershipBenefits and Perks to Help You Keep ClimbingOur culture is rooted in a shared dedication to living our values – Care, Integrity, Resilience, Servant Leadership, and Teamwork – every day, in everything we do. At Delta, our people are our success. At the heart of what we offer is our focus on Sharing Success with Delta employees. Exploring a career at Delta gives you a chance to see the world while earning great compensation and benefits to help you keep climbing along the way:Competitive salary, industry-leading proﬁt sharing program, and performance incentives 401(k) with generous company contributions up to 9% Paid time off including vacation, holidays, paid personal time, maternity and parental leave Comprehensive health beneﬁts including medical, dental, vision, short/long term disability and life beneﬁts Family care assistance through fertility support, surrogacy and adoption assistance, lactation support, subsidized back-up care, and programs that help with loved ones in all stages Holistic Wellbeing programs to support physical, emotional, social, and financial health, including access to an employee assistance program offering support for you and anyone in your household, free financial coaching, and extensive resources supporting mental health Domestic and International space-available flight privileges for employees and eligible family members Career development programs to achieve your long-term career goals World-wide partnerships to engage in community service and innovative goals created to focus on sustainability and reducing our carbon footprint Business Resource Groups created to connect employees with common interests to promote inclusion, provide perspective and help implement strategies Recognition rewards and awards through the platform Unstoppable Together Access to over 500 discounts, specialty savings and voluntary benefits through Deltaperks such as car and hotel rentals and auto, home, and pet insurance, legal services, and childcare What You Need To Succeed (minimum Qualifications)Must be able to compile compelling, concise presentations for leadership audiencesMust be a creative and innovative problem solverHighly quantitative with ability / desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic and evolving environmentAbility to translate data into insightsMust be self-motivated and intellectually curiousMust possess strong written and oral communication skillProficiency in Microsoft Office tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) a mustMust be performing
