title: Convenience Store Category Manager
job_description: The Atlanta Retailers Association is now hiring an experienced Convenience Store Category Manager. The ideal candidate will have 3-5 years of experience in convenience retail marketing/operations and/or 2-3 years of proven buying experience in the convenience retail industry. Experience in the convenience retail industry is a must.Job DescriptionProvides insights and recommendations to optimize new product introductions, distribution, shelving, price, and promotional mix by analyzing marketing and customer data. Analyzes and assesses category/brand performance to develop enhanced marketing and sales plans and promotions. This position helps in building vendor alliances and programs that can be expected to build long-term profitability. The Category Manager’s primary responsibilities include.Responsibilities Utilize data to Identify business trends, competitive market activity, shopper trends and product performance. Collaborate with multiple stakeholders to track performance of business objectives (shelf performance, product effectiveness, retailer initiatives) Build, update and refresh weekly and monthly dashboards (weekly POS + monthly category recaps) Provide ad hoc support as needed. As a category analyst you will play a critical role in supporting the team and building a strong partnership with our customer(s) You will conduct high quality analysis and synthesis of multi-source data to evaluate item performance, assortment planning and store clustering, while leveraging effective communication & influencing to orchestrate action. You are responsible for negotiating contracts, agreements, and terms of engagements with the suppliers. This includes discussing pricing, payment terms, delivery schedules, quality standards, and any other relevant terms beneficial to the association and its members. You work to secure the best possible prices for the products and services by analyzing pricing structures, identifying cost saving opportunities, and negotiating bulk discounts or volume incentives. Maintaining positive relationships with vendors is crucial, working closely with the vendors to understand their offerings, capabilities, and limitations, to establish open lines of communication to address concerns and facilitate transactions. Addressing issues related to delivery schedules, quality control, and complaints. Review and manage the terms and conditions of contracts, ensuring that they align with the guidelines laid by the current Board of Directors. To stay informed about the market trends, competitors’ pricing, and industry benchmarks, thereby negotiating more effectively by understanding the competitive landscape. Collaborating with various internal teams such as Territory Development Managers (TDM), Finance, and Legal, to gather information, align on requirements, to ensure contract compliance. To monitor contract expiration and or modifications. To re-negotiate the terms taking into consideration changes in the market conditions and the evolving needs of the C-store industries. To analyze data related to procurement activities, supplier’s performance and market trends for negotiation strategies. Participate in the development of category presentations incorporating syndicated data and other sources of data that address business issues. Work closely with the marketing & promotions team to ensure sales and gross profit budgets are exceeded. Keep abreast of customer(s) KPIs, strategies, and other important information. Develop marketing recommendations based on quantitative analysis and forecasting. Data mining, product level sales reporting, margin projection, market basket analysis, trend analysis, category forecasting, market benchmarking, and promotional analysis. Ensure effective communication and recapping of all programs for key stakeholders including field sales teams and key distributor personnel.Requirements 3-5 years of experience in retail marketing/operations and/or 2-3 years of proven buying experience in the convenience retail industry. BS/BA Degree in Marketing, Business, or related field. Robust and proven experience with Negotiation of Contracts Vendor Management experience Complex, longer-term strategic business planning experience required. Retail account management and retail marketing preferred. Experience with category development / management Ability to effectively influence key stakeholders to deliver business results. Exposure to distributor management or multi-tier distribution network preferred. Strong data and technical skills to include scan data, space management software, consumer demographic data, and Microsoft Office products (Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint). Strong analytical and information processing ability with the ability to extract business intelligence from data sources.

Consults with functional unit management and personnel to identify, define, and document business needs and objectives, current operational procedures, problems, input and output requirements, and levels of systems access. title: IT Business Analyst
job_description: Job Description:  Duties:      Analyzes complex business problems and processes and recommends efficiencies using automated solutions or process reengineering.     Provides technical expertise to business units (Finance, Telecom, Infrastructure, etc.) in identifying, evaluating, and developing system(s) solutions that are cost-effective and meet business unit(s) requirements.     Performs business analysis utilizing current best practices as recommended by the International Institute of Business Analysis Knowledge Areas.       (i.e. Business Analysis Planning & Monitoring; Elicitation & Collaboration; Requirements Life Cycle Management; Strategy Analysis; Requirements Analysis and Design; Solution Evaluation & Recommendation) and agile methodology user stories, epics, and release management.     Performs research based on accepted research techniques incorporating information from (but not limited to) industry-accepted professional organizations, relevant vendors, and acceptable market research firms such as Gartner, etc.     Prepare for and present presentations to stakeholders, project teams, and relevant review committees as required.     Writes, retains, and maintains system requirements and design documentation.     Creates detailed project documents, workflows, test scripts, and diagrams to provide clearly defined project deliverables.     Creates and organizes new supporting documents.     Creates user documentation to increase users' understanding of the final product and process re-engineering.     Edits content to ensure compliance with the organization's style guidelines and branding consistency.     Communicates and documents updates for users.     Assist assigned Project Managers with project planning and execution as necessary.     Create, review, and propose solution architectural diagrams.     Research, document and present project-related business unit processes\workflows utilizing the appropriate tools and processes.     Lead, work as a team, member, and collaborate on cross-functional teams.     Partners with the IT Security team in the prevention, analysis, and mitigation of IT security-related items.     Identifies and reports on compliance issues that require follow-up or investigation.     Tracks and fully documents all changes for functional and business specifications.     May be required to work with Developers (vendors), QA Testers, Project Managers and business unit representatives to articulate, develop, test, and validate functions for applications or network platforms\architectures.     Work with business unit teams to develop high-level cost estimates and possible ROI estimates.     Manage multiple competing priorities through effective communication and coordination.     Works with Procurement, Project Managers, Legal, and Business Unit Representatives to navigate the procurement process when required following organizational procurement procedures.      Decision Making:     Selects from multiple procedures and methods to accomplish tasks.       Applies organizational policies; may interpret organizational policies and recommend exceptions.       Establishes work methods, timetables, performance standards, etc.      Leadership Provided:     Routinely works as a part of cross-functional teams and provides work group leadership, guidance, and/or training to less experienced staff.      May lead cross-functional teams to address business issues.      Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:     This may not be an all-inclusive or exhaustive list.     Knowledge of concepts, theories, and best practices as set forth by a related professional organization such as the International Institute of Business Analysis (preferred) or Project Management Institute.     Well-developed communication and collaboration skills.     Professional documentation and presentation abilities within a technical and business organization.     Skills in organization and proposal\business case creation and presentation.     Ability to create reports and debrief C-Level executives and other organization members.     Capability to build and maintain relationships within the organization.     Utilization of the appropriate tools (at minimum) such as Office 365 (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Microsoft Visio, and Microsoft Project.     Aptitude to create use case scenarios and functional specifications.      Education and Experience:     Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, and equivalent experience.     5 years experience in an organizational technology and business environment utilizing tools and best practices to resolve business issues and accomplish organizational goals.     Masters degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, and equivalent degree area.     5 years experience in an organizational technology and business environment utilizing tools and best practices to resolve business issues and accomplish organizational goals.       Equivalent professional experience may be considered in lieu of a Masters degree.

title: Senior Business Data Analyst
job_description: This role is for an individual passionate about Data and has the business savviness to drive customer success through our Analytics product. The successful candidate will develop technical solutions to business problems by turning data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. The individual has strong analytical skills with the ability to acquire, organize, analyze, and disseminate information with attention to detail and accuracy. The candidate delivers analytics from conception to implementation including activities including data acquisition, analysis, mapping through to the delivery of the dashboards.  Responsibilities:Work with large amounts of data. Process and present numbers, trends to create stories and build hypotheses based on raw data. Establish correlations based on the business knowledge between disparate sources of data. Study business function; gathering information and acquiring domain expertise; evaluating output requirements and formats.Design and document process and data flows for establishing data pipelines to support analyses.Present analyses translate findings in the data into solutions or perform root cause analysis. Manage full delivery lifecycle; define requirements, write specifications, identify milestones, perform quality assurance through to the delivery of the product. Understanding the needs of multiple stakeholders and facilitating requirements amongst multiple stakeholders.Provides references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation, training users.Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.Position may require occasional travel.Skills:Proficiency in handling and analyzing large datasets, extracting insights, and presenting data trends effectively.Experience in designing and documenting process and data flows for establishing efficient data pipelines to support analytical tasks.Expertise in managing the full delivery lifecycle including defining requirements, writing specifications, ensuring quality assurance, and overseeing product delivery.Skill in understanding the needs of multiple stakeholders and facilitating requirements among various stakeholders.Skill in working with management to prioritize business and information needs effectively.Ability to create and maintain user documentation, deliver user training, and articulate complex ideas clearly both verbally and in writing.Effectively communicate and work with remote team members. Be able to articulate complex ideas clearly and easily. Minimum requirements: 5-8 years of proven working experience as Data, Business Analyst.A bachelor's degree or a master's degree in math, statistics, computer science or information management. 5 years of onsite/US experience is must.5+ years of experience using SQL.Familiarity with ETL platform.4+ years of experience with Tableau or similar Analytics product or Tableau certified.Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills.Data visualization techniques and toolsExcel data tools and pivot tablesWorking with remote teams.Experience in Retail, Supply Chain is a plus.
Job function: Business Development, Analyst, and Information Technology
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

title: Business and Data Analyst, GES L&TD
job_description: DescriptionThe GES Learning & Talent Development (L&TD) Team has an immediate opening for a highly skilled Business and Data Analyst in Northern Virginia (Arlington, VA) to solve business critical problems through data analysis. Driving the development of robust and semi /fully automated data reports and dashboards to deliver metrics and insights to the business within the learning and talent development space for our worldwide organization. This role has direct impact on the day-to-day decision making of large-scale programs and our ability to meet our business unit needs.This role drives operational excellence by: 1) deep diving critical data to develop and mature operational learning metrics, 2) identifying tactical and operational trends impacting organizational learning an talent improvement and gap analysis, 3) developing solutions that increase team and organizational efficiency through better data sets, and 4) advising or influencing business decisions that have multi-region impact using knowledge of data driven analytical processes.The Candidate must be highly analytical and possess a strong passion for tool development and analytics; set high standards for accountability with a focus on superior business success; and have a tenacity for continuous operational improvement. You will use your analytic talent, tool building skills, professional experience and judgment, technical aptitude, and personal skillsets to collaborate with a diverse set of stakeholders across multiple time zones to identify requirements, seek out and discover disparate, but related data sets, design solutions, remove bureaucratic blockers, and find creative ways to invent and simplify to meet business needs.You must be comfortable working with remote cross functional teams to deliver novel and sometimes pioneering solutions that will be used routinely multiple business unites; troubleshooting unforeseen and time-critical implementation issues as they arise; removing barriers to project success; and dealing with persistent uncertainty, organizational inertia, and business change. The ability to establish trust with a variety of internal customers and stakeholders, eliminate non-value-add activity, and find creative ways to accelerate project delivery is essential. Most importantly, you must be able to act independently (with limited oversight and guidance), using good judgement and effective communication to drive timely decision making and deliver high-quality results.Up to 15% travel may be necessary to support GES L&TD team efforts.If you demonstrate these qualities, are a "get stuff done" kind of person, and enjoy the challenges of delivering technical and highly innovative solutions, we look forward to receiving your application!Key job responsibilitiesInclude But Not Limited To Design and build custom reporting and dashboards to support GES L&TD operations. Run daily, weekly, monthly reports with an ongoing cadence to support the team with data to help with project execution. Create reporting and metrics to facilitate analyses and drive data-driven decision making Own the development and maintenance of new and existing artifacts focused on analysis of requirements, metrics, and reporting dashboards. Report key insight trends, using statistical rigor to simplify and inform the larger team of noteworthy story lines. Deep dive into large data sets to answer key business questions using SQL, Excel, and other data manipulation languages. Continually improve ongoing reporting and analysis processes, while automating or simplifying self-service support and access to authoritative data sets. Partner with execution/business teams to consult, develop and implement KPIs, automated reporting/process solutions, and process improvements to meet business needs. Prepare and deliver business requirements reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks. Own and perform individual deep dive analyses, including communicating results and implications to leaders. Generate weekly and monthly data reports for both internal and external business reviews. Learn and understand a broad range of Amazon’s data resources and know how, when, and which to use and which not to use Translate complex or ambiguous business problem statements into analysis requirements Scale data processes and reports; write queries that clients can update themselves; lead work with data engineering for full-scale automation Participate in strategic and tactical planning discussions. Excellent writing skills, to create artifacts easily digestible by business and tech partners. To support this initiative, you must be able to think strategically, perform dive deep analytics, and communicate effectively with internal and external senior leadership. Excellent communication skills are required.A day in the lifeAmazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full-time employees include: Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage Maternity and Parental Leave Options Paid Time Off (PTO) 401(k) PlanIf you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skillsets. If you’re passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply!We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:Arlington, VA, USA | Atlanta, GA, USA | Nashville, TN, USABasic Qualifications 3+ years of business analyst, data analyst or similar role experience Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights 3+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience 3+ years of Excel or Tableau (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables) experience Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders Bachelor's degree in business or analytical discipline Experience with SQLPreferred Qualifications Master's degree in business or analytical discipline 5+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience Experience partnering with executive-level leaders to identifying and solving business issuesAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.Company - Amazon.com Services LLCJob ID: A2608157

title: Sr Revenue Cycle Business Analyst
job_description: DescriptionJOB PURPOSE:The Sr. Analyst provides oversight and support for Revenue Cycle integrity and workflow processes using data analytics. The Sr. Analyst assures all established billing, systems, and process requirements have been met in order to ensure timely and optimal reimbursement. Through the analysis of key performance indicator data, the Sr. Analyst works to improve Revenue Cycle production and efficiency. The Sr. Analyst recommends changes that will positively impact the Revenue Cycle and help Piedmont Healthcare (PHC) operate according to industry benchmarks and meet A/R performance goals and productivity. The Sr. Analyst will improve and implement internal controls over the revenue cycle and will work closely with IT on interface and system issues as required to improve the flow of data. The Sr. Analyst may lead projects for Revenue Cycle.QualificationsMINIMUM EDUCATION REQUIRED:Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Finance or a closely related field required.In lieu of degree, six (6) years of relevant work experience will be accepted in addition to the experience requirement.Minimum Experience RequiredThree (3) years of experience exhibiting advanced performance in physician and/or hospital billing revenue cycle required.(If no degree, a total of nine (9) years of experience required).Minimum Licensure/Certification Required By LawNone.Additional QualificationsAdvanced knowledge of third-party insurance, and familiarity with insurance plan types; HMO, PPO, POS, and Indemnity.Excellent knowledge of Government Programs, including Medicare (CPT, ICD coding/reimbursement, and Medicare Fraud & Abuse regulations), Medicaid and Tricare Programs.Tableau and Epic proficiency.Possesses thorough knowledge of HIPAA regulations.Possesses advanced knowledge of Revenue Cycle Systems.Healthcare experience in data analytics, systems performance, and/or accounting. Experience with root-cause analysis and lean processes.#GD

title: Staff Analyst, Product (Mailchimp)
job_description: OverviewMailchimp is a leading marketing platform for small businesses. We empower millions of customers around the world to build their brands and grow their companies with a suite of marketing automation, multichannel campaign, CRM, and analytics tools.Our analytics team is a growing team here at Mailchimp to support our strategic initiatives, business operations and revenue management as Mailchimp continues to evolve. We are seeking a motivated and energetic data analyst to support the growth of the analytics function of this team.As a Staff Product Analyst on the Product Analytics team, you will help lead strategic, data-driven decision making at Mailchimp. In this role, you will apply a variety of analytical tools and techniques to conduct deep dive analysis to both help understand and better explain customer behavior and business trends as well as predict future business outcomes. You will partner with stakeholders across the company -- product, finance, marketing, legal, and others -- to support the business on strategic analytics requests and build cross-functional reporting to arm Mailchimp with insights that will help steer our future.This position is based in Atlanta, GA or New York City. title: Associate Manager, DashMart - Product Operations
job_description: About The TeamDashMart is a staple of our New Verticals function here at DoorDash, focused on building a new type of convenience store that offers both household essentials and local restaurant favorites to our customers' doorsteps.About The RoleYou will sit on our DashMart Strategy & Operations team, with a focus on supply chain. In this role, you will own the entire lifecycle of product implementations, from sparking ideas to executing game-changing products, tools, and processes that catapult DashMart's growth and efficiency. You will help scale our EDI platform through the implementation of net-new documents, and improving the flow of data between our systems through integration enhancements. You will identify opportunities for process optimization and implement improvements to enhance overall supply chain efficiency. You will be responsible for requirements gathering, overseeing solution builds, user acceptance testing (UAT), change management, and runway/roll out for all your projects. You will collaborate with Product and Engineering, Business Systems, Accounting, Operations and other DashMart teams to build solutions and operationalize rollout.You will report into the Manager on our Product Operations team. We are in a hybrid model, so we spend some time in person & some time working from home.You’re Excited About This Opportunity Because You Will…Lead. You’ll lead the implementation of several DashMart programs (across product, tooling, process and integrations).Build. You’ll manage and develop sustainable processes, tools, and systems to enable our Supply Chain team to be efficient and optimizedAnalyze. You’ll use SQL to derive quantitative insights on the current state of our tools and identify new ways to approach our future state.Collaborate. You’ll work closely with Business Systems, Accounting, Product, Engineering, Operations and external third party vendors to build scalable systems and processes to support all business partners.Flex. You’ll sit in Operations, but you’ll wear different hats (product manager, project manager, change manager, strategist, data analyst) in order to drive outcomes for covered projects. We’re Excited About You Because…You're an owner. You are detail-oriented and organized, and not afraid to get your hands dirty to “do what it takes” to get things done.You make room at the table for diverse perspectives. Navigating complex problems and leading stakeholders towards a common goal, you prioritize the need to foster critical cross functional relationships from diverse parts of the businessYou solve problems from first principles. You're excited to solve problems in innovative ways, and you resist "this is how it's always been done" thinking. You love working with data and can work independently in SQL to root cause problems.You're unafraid of ambiguity. Rapid change and learning is exciting to you, and you thrive in ambiguous, startup environments.You understand the procure-to-pay lifecycle and have experience working in systems such as EDI, ERPs and WMSs.You’re a clear communicator. You can gather information from multiple sources and distill complex problems into succinct statements for different audiences. You have 4-6+ years of experience within project, product or program management. You’ve succeeded in fast-paced cultures (tech, operations, strategy, consulting, banking, or a related experience), and you’ve led teams to achieve audacious goals.About DoorDashAt DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly, learn, and reiterate in order to make impactful decisions that display empathy for our range of users—from Dashers to merchant partners to consumers. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door-to-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods.DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.Our Commitment to Diversity and InclusionWe’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.Statement of Non-Discrimination: In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital/domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on “protected categories,” we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at DoorDash. We value a diverse workforce – people who identify as women, non-binary or gender non-conforming, LGBTQIA+, American Indian or Native Alaskan, Black or African American, Hispanic or Latinx, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, differently-abled, caretakers and parents, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Thank you to the Level Playing Field Institute for this statement of non-discrimination.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and any other state or local hiring regulations, we will consider for employment any qualified applicant, including those with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the applicable regulation.If you need any accommodations, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection.CompensationThe location-specific base salary range for this position is listed below. Compensation in other geographies may vary.Actual compensation within the pay range will be decided based on factors including, but not limited to, skills, prior relevant experience, and specific work location. For roles that are available to be filled remotely, base salary is localized according to employee work location. Please discuss your intended work location with your recruiter for more information.DoorDash cares about you and your overall well-being, and that’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package, for full-time employees, that includes healthcare benefits, a 401(k) plan including an employer match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, wellbeing benefits, paid time off, paid parental leave, and several paid holidays, among others.In addition to base salary, the compensation package for this role also includes opportunities for equity grants.We expect this position to be filled by 6/1/2024.We use Covey as part of our hiring and / or promotional process for jobs in NYC and certain features may qualify it as an AEDT. As part of the evaluation process we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate submitted applications. title: Senior Analyst, Pricing/Profit Improvement
job_description: TriMark USA is the country’s largest provider of design services, equipment, and supplies to the foodservice industry. We proudly serve our customers by providing design services, commercial equipment, and foodservice supplies across a wide range of industries and business sectors. Headquartered in Massachusetts, with a history dating back to 1896, we have locations across the country that offer foodservice operators an unparalleled level of service by combining our unique design capabilities and our expert market knowledge with the purchasing strength, delivery, installation, and after-sales service capabilities of a national company. Our employees are focused on creating customized solutions for our clients to ensure they achieve their culinary goals while upholding our I.C.A.R.E. values: Integrity , Customer Service , Accountability , Respect , and Excellence . For more information, please visit: www.trimarkusa.com Why you’ll love it here!  Benefits include Medical, Dental, Vision, Tuition Reimbursement, Pet, and Legal Insurance.Position Summary The Senior Pricing/Profit Improvement Analyst reports to the Senior Vice President, Pricing & Business Analytics.  Located in Mansfield, MA.  Full-Time  Hybrid As a Senior Pricing/Profit Improvement Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in driving the company's growth through meticulous analysis of category and customer profitability. You will bring expertise in financial analysis, pricing strategies, and project management to enhance overall profitability. This position requires a proactive and strategic approach to contribute to ongoing initiatives, collaborate with sales leadership, and assist in achieving annual incremental EBITDA targets.Essential Functions & Responsibilities  Profitability Data Development:  Lead the ongoing development of profitability data sets, ensuring accuracy and maintaining data quality standards.  Create comprehensive fact bases for divisions, identifying trends, opportunities, and hypotheses to optimize profitability.  Pricing and Financial Analysis:  Conduct thorough pricing analysis, financial assessments, and perform distribution and account deep-dives.  Drive category reviews and actively contribute to initiatives aimed at maximizing overall profitability.  Sales Leadership Support:  Collaborate with divisional sales leadership to track and implement actions identified through profitability initiatives.  Take accountability for achieving annual incremental EBITDA targets and identify continuous improvement opportunities.  Data Management and Reporting:  Manage data input and output effectively using business profitability tools.  Oversee reporting related to customer profitability and margin targets, providing insightful management reports and presentations.  Recommendations and Action Tracking:  Provide strategic recommendations and hypotheses on actions to improve profitability based on comprehensive reports.  Facilitate and manage the ongoing account review process, ensuring effective action tracking.  Data Integrity and Auditing:  Conduct regular audits on applications and processes to maintain data integrity.  Collaborate with IT liaisons to define data requirements for corporate-wide reporting systems.  Ad Hoc Projects:  Undertake ad hoc projects, analyses, and data extractions as assigned, showcasing adaptability and analytical prowess. Competencies Demonstrated expertise in financial analysis, pricing strategies, and project management.  Proactive problem-solving mindset with a bias for action.  Strong analytical skills and a deep understanding of corporate financial data.  Exceptional organizational and prioritization skills.  Effective written and verbal communication skills.  Proven ability to manage and prioritize tasks effectively. Qualifications & Experience 4 – 6 years of experience in a pricing, financial analysis, or related role, or equivalent military or practical experience.  Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel with advanced analytical capabilities.  Strong understanding of business profitability tools.  Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, and/or Alteryx.  Ability to successfully pass a background check post offer acceptance. The range provided represents the national average pay range for this position and is considered to be a general guideline. Pay for this position will reflect the candidate’s unique qualifications and may be higher or lower than the range provided based on employee geographic location. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other local, state, and federal law.In addition to base salary, this role will be eligible for participation in TriMark’s’ benefits programs, including medical, dental, vision, 401K (with employer match), etc. Leadership positions may also qualify for participation in bonus programs commensurate with role and scope of responsibility.TriMark’s commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging is a purposeful mission of strengthening our organization and those we serve by uniting the unique and beautiful differences of our employees. This mission is instilled in the fiber of who we are as a company, setting the standard for our industry. We are committed to promoting diversity, inclusion and belonging through sharing, education, and experiences.TriMark USA provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to accommodations@trimarkusa.com .Apply Now

title: Senior Valuation Analyst
job_description: Censeo Advisors, LLC is headquartered in the Atlanta metropolitan area and supports clients across the country. We are a professional services firm dedicated to providing proven business valuation, financial advisory, tangible asset appraisal, and forensic analysis services.We are currently seeking a Senior Business Valuation Associate to join us. Our Associates play a critical role in the execution of our various services. This position is designed to provide a broad range of professional development experiences, enabling you to contribute early and often to nearly every phase of a client engagement.Associates on our team have the opportunity to tackle a wide variety of interesting projects, including valuations of business entities, tangible and intangible assets, and intellectual property; employee stock ownership plan (“ESOP”) valuation and adequate consideration opinions; tax planning and compliance valuation; forensic accounting investigations; transaction fairness opinions and solvency opinions; lost profits and economic damages analyses; acquisition method analyses and impairment studies; transaction support and due diligence; and complex capital structure allocations.We have a strong track record of developing and empowering professionals to ensure they stay challenged and passionate about what we do, not just for our clients but for our team members.What Will You Do?Analyze client financial statements and ancillary informationManage client data and document requests and collectionPrepare due diligence and management interview questionsParticipate in communications and dialogues with client personnel and representativesConduct industry and economic researchPerform valuation modeling, including discounted cash flow, merged, and acquired, and guideline public company analysesGenerate client deliverables including valuation exhibits, letters, reports, and other presentationsWhat Will You Need to Do It?Undergraduate degree in Finance or a related field with strong record of academic performanceFamiliarity with, and coursework in, finance, economics, and accounting preferred, but not mandatory; liberal arts backgrounds will also be consideredExcellent report-writing and verbal communication skills, and strong analytical and problem-solving capabilitiesProficiency in Microsoft Office products with emphasis on Word, Excel, and PowerPointAttention to detail, healthy skepticism, commitment to excellence, desire to learn and improve, and initiativeAbility to thrive in a team-oriented, timeline-driven environment, prioritize tasks, and work on multiple assignments concurrentlyStrong work ethic and willingness to work long hours as project backlog dictatesApplicants must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorshipWhat Will We Do for You?Provide competitive compensation and benefitsDevelop Analysts into high-performing workplace contributorsPromote work-life balanceFoster a culture of collegiality, diligence, and prideExpose Analysts to a multitude of client industries and project purposesCultivate Analysts, professionally, with regular training, mentorship, professional designation pursuit, and performance feedbackThis is a full-time, in-office position in our Atlanta, GA offices offering a competitive compensation package.

title: Solutions Analyst (Digital Technology) - Atlanta, GA
job_description: Job ID: 492110Oldcastle APG, a CRH Company, is the leading provider of outdoor living solutions in North America with an award-winning portfolio that enables customers to Live Well Outside. Inspiring endless possibilities with enduring performance, its collection of premier building products create inviting outdoor spaces where people connect, reflect and recharge. The manufacturer's signature brands include Belgard® and Echelon® hardscape and masonry materials; Barrette Outdoor Living® and MoistureShield® fencing, decking and railing; Sakrete® and Amerimix® packaged concrete and mortar; Techniseal® sands, jointing technologies and surface protectors; PebbleTec® pool finishes; plus popular brands of landscape and gardening materials.**Job Summary**We are looking for a dynamic and accomplished Solutions Analyst to join our Digital Technology team. In this role, you will be instrumental in analyzing, designing, and implementing technology solutions to elevate our systems and processes. The preferred candidate will possess a robust foundation in IT systems, business and data analysis, and a profound understanding of manufacturing operations, including experience in B2B/B2C ecommerce, ERP, CRM, PIMS, MarTech, DataLake, and related technologies.**Responsibilities** Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into effective system solutions. Conduct system analysis to identify areas for improvement and efficiencies for Digital Solutions in Manufacturing domain. Act as a liaison between IT and business stakeholders, ensuring alignment of technology solutions with business goals. Design and implement technology solutions to streamline operations and enhance productivity, with a focus on B2B/B2C ecommerce, ERP, CRM, PIMS, MarTech, DataLake, etc. Knowledge and experience with Salesforce technologies will be a huge plus. Perform data analysis to extract meaningful insights and support data-driven decision-making. Collaborate with IT teams to ensure seamless integration of systems and applications. Provide technical support and troubleshooting for system-related issues. Utilize business analysis techniques to gather, document, and validate requirements. Conduct stakeholder interviews and facilitate workshops to elicit business needs. Develop comprehensive business cases and impact assessments for proposed solutions. Stay current with industry trends and technologies, willing to explore and experiment with competing technologies, and recommend improvements and advancements.**Requirements** Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business, or related fields. 3+ years proven experience as a Solutions/Systems Analyst, preferably in manufacturing and retail domains. Demonstrated experience in complex B2B/B2C ecommerce, ERP, CRM, PIMS, MarTech, DataLake, and related systems. Excel in understanding data structures and streamlined integrations between systems. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Knowledge of Salesforce, scripting, and database technologies will be a plus. Excellent communication and collaboration skills with both internal and external (vendor and agency partner) teams. Good understanding of Agile development methodologies and processes.**What CRH Offers You** Highly competitive base pay Comprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programs Group retirement savings program Health and wellness programs A diverse and inclusive culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion**About CRH**CRH has a long and proud heritage. We are a collection of hundreds of family businesses, regional companies and large enterprises that together form the CRH family. CRH operates in a decentralized, diversified structure that allows you to work in a small company environment while having the career opportunities of large international organization.If you're up for a rewarding challenge, we invite you to take the first step and apply today! Once you click apply now, you will be brought to our official employment application. Please complete your online profile and it will be sent to the hiring manager. title: Analyst, Investment Strategy ~ Logistics
job_description: LocationAtlanta - 1180 Peachtree St. NE, Suite 1575BusinessFor many, logistics are about order, organization, and orchestration. But at Brookfield Properties, we believe they can be so much more. It’s why our logistics solutions are imaginative. Ingenious. Inspiring. No matter the challenge, we deliver a fresh, personalized approach for our customers that never compromises on quality, efficiency, or security. Because where others see obstacles, we see opportunities.If you're ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.Job DescriptionBrookfield Properties is a fully-integrated, global real estate services company that provides industry-leading portfolio management and development capabilities across the real estate investment strategies of Brookfield Asset Management — a global alternative asset manager with $600 billion in assets under management.Our logistics business is a vertically integrated portfolio of 145M square feet across a footprint spanning five continents. We don't just build and manage buildings. We develop the hubs of commerce that connect people and goods globally – places that are the backbone of an ever-evolving supply chain. We're elevating the logistics business as we envision – and then deliver – the world's most forward-thinking properties, creating spaces where people, businesses, and communities thrive.OverviewThe Atlanta, GA based Logistics Investment Strategy Analyst’s primary role will be to support the US Logistics team by developing our investment strategy and supporting decision making. The investment management team studies real estate market, supply chain, and economic trends to guide investment and portfolio management. The analyst will use advanced analytics to update and build new tools for the broader US logistics team using both third party and proprietary Brookfield data.Key AccountabilitiesAssist in the ongoing development of our US logistics strategy through the selection of our target markets. Work alongside our investment and portfolio management teams to study supply/demand, economic, and demographic trends.Support investment teams by building tools and preparing the market analysis for new acquisitions and developments. Utilize GIS system to understand demographic (including labor) and economic demand drivers at the investment level.Administer our data strategy by gathering, organizing, and preparing analysis. Work alongside internal and external partners to execute the strategy and develop predictive data analytics tools. Maintain and implement Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, and Large Language Models to utilize the power of our data and Brookfield ecosystem.Provide support to broad US Logistics team on how to utilize various tools, models and systems the Investment Strategy team maintains.Track US and global trends that affect our business and share those with the global teams. Prepare our logistics dashboard monthly and implement improvements.Gather data and aid in the preparation of presentations for various board, fund, investor, and industry groups.Candidate ProfileBachelor’s Degree with a concentration in Business, Economics, Data Analytics, Real Estate and/or Finance preferred.1-3 years experience in real estate, research/strategy, consulting, or business analytics role.Thrives on creative problem solving and innovation – “outside the box” thinker.Strong analytical skill with ability to organize, analyze, and summarize large data sets. Advanced Microsoft Excel skills required. Experience with Machine Learning, Programming, Relational Databases, Power BI is a plus.Effective communication, time management, and presentation skills.Ability to work well in a team, confidently sharing ideas and recommendations.Brookfield CultureBrookfield has a unique and dynamic culture. We seek team members who have a long-term focus and whose values align with our Attributes of a Brookfield Leader: Entrepreneurial, Collaborative and Disciplined. Brookfield is committed to the development of our people through challenging work assignments and exposure to diverse businesses.Brookfield Asset Management is committed to maintaining a Positive Work Environment that is safe and respectful; our shared success depends on it. Accordingly, we do not tolerate workplace discrimination, violence or harassment.Brookfield is an EEO employer and does not make hiring decisions based on status in a protected class. We are proud to create a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are grateful for your interest in this position, however, only candidates selected for pre-screening will be contacted.#BPUS

title: Senior Business Analyst, SAP (Ariba)
job_description: YOUR MISSION: Provide technical support and assistance for the SAP Ariba Supply Chain Collaboration (SCC) and Procure-to-Pay (PTP). Responsible for troubleshooting and resolving issues related to SCC and PTP functionalities, ensuring smooth operation and user satisfaction. Investigate incidents, provide guidance to users, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to address complex technical challenges.Watch this video  to see how our employees are shaping the technologies that move us. Meet PanasonicMeet the recruiter: Courtney WinstonA DAY IN THE LIFE: Serve as the primary point of contact for users seeking support and assistance with SAP Ariba SCC and PTP modules.Respond to and resolve support tickets, incidents, and inquiries related to SCC and PTP functionalities, configuration, and usage.Troubleshoot technical issues reported by users, including system errors, data discrepancies, and process-related problems.Configure SAP ECC as needed to enable business requirements.Develop ECC to Ariba mapping requirements due to a change in business process or enabling new vendors.Collaborate with users, developers, and business analysts to investigate and resolve complex technical challenges within the SCC and PTP modules.Provide guidance and training to users on SCC and PTP functionalities, features, and best practices.Monitor SCC and PTP modules CIG – Cloud Integration Gateway, and proactively identifying and addressing potential issues.Document support activities, including troubleshooting steps, resolutions, and user interactions, for future reference and knowledge sharing.Participate in the testing and validation of SCC and PTP system changes and enhancements, ensuring proper functionality and user experience.Collaborate with the SCC/PTP implementation team to provide insights and recommendations for system improvements and user experience enhancements.Collaborate with Supplier Enablement team on Wave plan and supplier launch timeline.MUST-HAVES: Four-year college degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Administration, or equivalent technical degree required.Minimum of Five (5) years of SAP Business Analysis I the SCC and PTP modules or related experience required.Strong knowledge of SAP modules (such as SSC, PTP, FI, CO, MM, SD, PP, PM, QM) and integration points between them, or SAP Certification preferred. Solid understanding of supply chain management and procurement processes. This includes Direct Purchase Orders, Scheduling Agreement, Consignment, Subcontract, and drop shipProficiency in troubleshooting and resolving technical issues related to SAP modules, especially Ariba SCC, CIG and SAP MM.Excellent communications, analytical and problem-solving skillsExperience with project management methodologies and toolsExperience in working in high-volume automotive manufacturing or warehousing environment preferred. Strong proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, VisioBENEFITS & PERKS - WE'RE ALL ABOUT YOU: Great Medical/Dental BenefitsCompany-Matched 401K Retirement SavingsAnnual Bonus ProgramEducational AssistanceRelaxed Dress CodePASATalks Speaker SummitsLeadership & Mentorship ProgramsHigh5 Reward Recognition ProgramOnsite Happy HoursAnd many more benefits & perks found within the ‘Our Culture’ section… WHO WE ARE: At Panasonic, our technology and engineering expertise delivers innovation across diverse industries. It's all about the consumer experience and making sure that we find ways to enhance that experience, either through audio enhancements or through safety enhancements inside the vehicle.Panasonic Automotive Systems Company of America (PASA) is an industry-leading global supplier to Automotive Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM’s) for infotainment systems and advanced connected car solutions. Our clients include Ford, GM, Chrysler, Daimler, Fiat, Tesla, Honda, Toyota.WE TAKE OPPORTUNITY SERIOUSLY: Panasonic is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to: race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law. All qualified individuals are required to perform the essential functions of the job with our without reasonable accommodations.Due to the high volume of responses, we will only be able to respond to candidates of interest. All candidates must have valid authorization to work in the U.S. Thank you for your interest in Panasonic Automotive Systems of America.

title: BI Analyst
job_description: Company DescriptionAt Fortune Brands Innovations, we believe that our innovation and success are fueled by the passion of our people and the strength of our teams. Together, we work to fulfill dreams of home by aligning around common goals, being agile in the face of change, holding ourselves accountable, and acting with integrity and transparency. We succeed when everyone belongs and strive to build a Home for All where all associates can be their true, authentic selves at work.Job DescriptionProvides analytical solutions to complex business problems by mining data, conducting analysis, and generating actionable, relevant insights.Support the Retail Strategic Account Team’s data and analytics requests by gathering business requirements, sourcing and validating data, analyzing data, synthesizing insights, and presenting results.Leverage analytical tools and methodologies to recommend plans to drive sales growth, improve margins, and optimize inventory levels.Analyze sales and inventory trends, research demand drivers, and develop data-driven recommendations to drive sales growth and improve profitability.Develop and automate daily, weekly, monthly, and seasonal reporting and dashboards to monitor the business’ health and to share business insights with Sales, Marketing, and Finance stakeholders.Conduct and support analysis across multiple large-scale data sources (structured and unstructured) to identify and socialize key facts and insights.Collaborate with Retail Strategic Account Teams, Marketing, Finance, and Information Technology (IT) to understand business needs and identify key opportunities and challenges, particularly in defining analytical problem statements and building the fact basis needed to create recommendations.Partner with retail customers to leverage vendor reporting tools and data sources to support external customers and the internal sales team.Partner with internal and external IT and Data/Analytics teams to develop immediate and long-term data analytics tools and infrastructure.QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Engineering, Data Science, Statistics, Applied Math, Business Intelligence or a related quantitative discipline is required.Minimum of 3 years of experience in a Business Intelligence-related, analytical roleExperience in extracting, manipulating, and analyzing data, drawing conclusions and making recommendations.Experience with business intelligence and visualization toolkits such as Qlik and/or TableauExperience developing solutions using large volumes of dataDemonstrated a sense of urgency and ability to perseverance to reach objectives for challenging problems.Strong communication skills with experience presenting and translating data into decision-ready insights are preferred.Experience supporting and analyzing the retail industry preferredProficient in the use of Microsoft Office Suite. Intermediate to Advanced Excel skills is required.Ability to travel ~10%Additional InformationAt Fortune Brands Innovations, we support the overall health and wellness of our associates by offering comprehensive, competitive benefits that prioritize all aspects of wellbeing and provide flexibility for our teammates’ unique needs. This includes robust health plans, a market-leading 401(k) program with a company contribution, product discounts, flexible time off benefits (including half-day summer Fridays per policy), inclusive fertility / adoption benefits, and more. We offer numerous ERGs (Employee Resource Groups) to support inclusivity and our associates’ feeling of belonging at work.Fortune Brands Innovation (FBIN) is built on industry-leading brands and innovation within our operating segments: water, outdoors and security. We have an impressive track record of strong financial results, market outperformance and growth, which translates into career and professional growth opportunities for associates. Please visit our website at fbin.com to learn moreEqual Employment OpportunityFBIN is an equal opportunity employer. FBIN evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, disability/handicap status, marital status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic history or information, or any other legally protected characteristic.Reasonable AccommodationsFBIN is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please contact us at FBIN.Recruiting@fbhs.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

title: SAP Concur iXp Intern - Business Strategy Analyst - SUMMER 2024
job_description: We help the world run betterOur company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? What You’ll DoPosition title: SAP Concur iXp Intern – Business Strategy AnalystLocation: Atlanta, GA (Hybrid)Expected start date: June 2024Duration: Summer Internship (3 Months)Schedule: 40 HR/weekNote: Potential Part Time Extension into the school year (Sep - Nov 2024)* The SAP Concur IXp Intern – Business Strategy Analyst Will Have The Opportunity To Lead a Real-world Summer Project Via The SAP Concur Launch Process And Monitor Actual Results. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.EOE AA M/F/Vet/DisabilityQualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.Compensation Range Transparency: SAP believes the value of pay transparency contributes towards an honest and supportive culture and is a significant step toward demonstrating SAP’s commitment to pay equity. Management system.Provide oversight of other related business management systems for Plant Operations and Supply Chain Services.Define and support implementation, optimization, maintenance, troubleshooting, and upgrading needs of the systems.Develop and implement reporting, training, and user interface requirements.Responsible to provide reliable and efficient electric power generation in accordance with corporate safety policies and procedures, compliance with Electric Reliability Organization, NERC, SERC, Reliability Standards, FERC, EPA, EPD, OSHA, DOT, and all applicable governmental regulations.Provide day-to-day management and control of Maximo Asset Management and other related business system applications, including changes, configuration control, and data system operation and usage questions, comments and/or problems from the specific user community.Participate in organization and site meetings, including but not limited to Maximo Governance Board, to support the direction of the governance board, to maintain awareness of current activities and actions to be processed in the business management systems, and to maintain close contact with users.Develop and maintain key business process documentation related to Maximo Asset Management processes.Maintain electronic workflow processes within the systems that mirror the current title: Sr Business System Analyst

title: Business System Analyst, I (Maximo)
job_description: The Business System Analyst for Maximo will assist in analyzing business processes for the Operational and Maintenance department and optimizing those associated with asset management and maintenance activities. This role will collaborate with other analysts across the company to help ensure that the systems continue to work seamlessly with one another.Required QualificationsEducation: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Systems/Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field.Experience: Zero to three (3) years of experience using programming skills preferably with an electric utility or power systems environment.Specialized Skills (e.g., computer, software): Excellent presentation, communication, organization, planning, and interpersonal skills needed to successfully work with a large array of peers to accomplish tasks. title: ETL Business Systems Analyst
job_description: Job Title: ETL Business Systems AnalystLocation: Atlanta, GADuration: Long term Note: Candidate must be local and available for a face-face interviewJob DescriptionBachelor's degree or equivalent working experience with minimum of 8+ years of IT experience.Required SkillsThe Business Systems Analyst role on the BTS - Data Warehouse team requires experience in creating Business Requirement Documents, Functional Requirement Documents and Mapping documents for the development of ETL applications. This role requires extensive SQL experience in writing complex queries across multiple tables, data analysis and profiling skills for the creation of the mapping documents and further discussion with data modelers for the necessary table designs. This may include weekend and off hours support.

title: Technical Business / Systems Analyst
job_description: We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Technical Business and Systems Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong and diverse technical background as well as an understanding of the lottery business and understands or can gain a quick understanding of the IT systems and solutions that support the various lottery implementations.This role will be responsible for interfacing with various SMEs on technical teams and being the key interface to our centralized RFP team who are crafting comprehensive and compelling responses to Requests for Proposals (RFPs) related to lottery technology solutions. This individual will work closely with many various distributed technology teams to gather necessary information and create detailed and cohesive technical response to various RFPs. The proposal should effectively address client needs and requirements while following a central theme.In this role, you will be reviewing and analyzing RFP documents to understand client requirements, evaluation criteria, and submission guidelines. While we have a central team that does much of the main content, this role will include content creation and will require high-quality written content for RFP responses, including executive summaries, technical solutions, implementation plans, and pricing strategies.You will be the bridge between our various technical teams as well as the business side preparing the RFP response. You will collaborate with subject matter experts, sales teams, and other stakeholders to gather relevant information and ensure accuracy and completeness of proposals. You will customize proposal content to align with client needs and preferences, highlighting the unique value proposition of our lottery technology solutions.Quality is critical so you will also provide reviews and edits to ensure proposals are well-written, cohesive, and align to the product being offered. You will also need to manage proposal timelines, milestones, and deliverables to ensure timely submission of high-quality proposals. Over time, you will be responsible to maintain a repository of proposal content, templates, and best practices for future reference and continuous improvement.In addition to a strong technical background and a good understanding of systems, software development, databases, cloud technologies, messaging and other technical topics, what other experience is required?Lottery Experience - We ideally would like to find someone that is familiar with the various systems used to run the lottery in various states in the US.Good documentation experience and samples of documents you have written to explain how technical systems work ....some demonstrated expertise in software, infrastructure, public cloud, networking, terminals/kiosks, etc.This is a 6-9-month contract to start and you can do this work 100% remotely from where you live in the US. We prefer someone that is working EST or CST hours as we typically are working EST hours. This contract engagement could go longer or could become a full-time role over time. Full benefits are available during the contract engagement. Technical Business / Systems Analyst

Experience in reviewing and testing the key reports ensuring the risks (completeness & accuracy) related to IPE’s (Information Produced by Entity) are addressed. title: Associate Analyst, People Operations (Fixed-Term Contract)
job_description: Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Chicago, IL, USA; Atlanta, GA, USA; Austin, TX, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA; Seattle, WA, USA; Washington D.C., DC, USA.Minimum qualifications:Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.5 years of experience interacting with and manipulating data using tools such as SQL, R, or other statistical languages.5 years of experience working with multiple data sources, combining information to generate insights from analyses, and creating reporting solutions for an executive audience (e.g., dashboards, tables, templates, metrics).Preferred qualifications:Experience with headcount capacity planning and/or HR Operations.Excellent business acumen and executive presentation skills with the ability to translate data and analysis into business insights.Experience developing client-oriented solutions, with an emphasis on creativity and diligence, displaying excellent communications skills and attention to detail.Experience collaborating on projects involving multiple teams and managing ongoing client relationships.Experience with mathematical modeling, resource planning, machine learning, statistics, operational research, or conducting research using basic statistics.Experience with Python.About The JobAt Google, data drives all of our decision-making, and our HR organization is no exception. The People Analytics team acts as an internal innovation lab, using analytical approaches to make sure Google continues to be a great place to work. The team provides critical support to the business around issues of organizational health and is responsible for not just taking the pulse of our Googlers, but harnessing Googler feedback to drive change for the better. As an analyst you'll be detail-oriented and conscientious, analytical and curious. You're a strong problem-solver, who uses both quantitative and qualitative methods to get things done. And on top of it all, you're someone who wonders "What if?" and then seeks out the solution.As an analyst in People Experience (PX), you will work closely with PX Leadership and Google’s central finance teams to lead action-oriented analyses, drive critical decisions about PX resourcing, and provide regular reports on performance and trends. You will own a core area of PX capacity planning, understand key drivers, own development of capacity models and forecasts, flag risks, and partner with stakeholders to drive their strategic planning ensuring that PX is well-informed and able to make thoughtful, data-driven decisions.Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.The US base salary range for this full-time position is $113,000-$165,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .ResponsibilitiesOwn a core area of PX capacity planning from end to end including setting the product roadmap, data modeling, reporting, and getting stakeholder buy-in.Be a thought partner and trusted advisor for PX Leadership and POps Finance to provide insights and recommendations grounded in data.Lead development of new analysis to drive data-driven recommendations and diagnose root cause issues. Partner cross-functionally to develop automated solutions at scale.Prioritize and work effectively in an environment with competing demands.Be a thought leader and drive positive change by challenging the status quoGoogle is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Senior Financial Analyst, Amazon Transportation Services
job_description: DescriptionAmazon Transportation Services (ATS) connects our customers and our shippers. We combine people, technology and products to deliver for our customers at the lowest possible cost. Surface Transportation is the conveyor belt to connect the entire Amazon supply chain. We are a technology company that executes transportation, and we get to do it all at a scale that nobody has ever seen!We love what we do. We have an incredible team that works hard to change the industry. We are inventing new things each and every day. We rolled out technology in the last two years that rivals anything inside of the transportation space in the last 100 years.As our business grows, we are going to use the same technology and the same standard best practices to build and invent all over the world. If you are interested in growing something new and different, there is an opportunity to do it inside of this space.Career OpportunitiesSurface Transportation is seeking an experienced and highly motivated Financial Analyst II to join its Middle Mile Finance team. This is an exciting opportunity to create and innovate on behalf of our customers and build the transportation experience of the future. This role will have heavy impact and high visibility to the long term strategy for the business, and it will require strong partnership with the Operations teams as well as Finance, Accounting and Technology. Experience with this team opens up amazing career opportunities across Amazon, such as senior roles supporting an impressive array of business areas, project management roles, and/or management opportunities locally, regionally, and globally.It is not just a truck driving down the highway. If you like taking a larger scope identifying the most cost effective and safest way to deliver to our customer you will enjoy transportation. This entire system has to move like a symphony and it has to be orchestrated. It is an incredible math problem that we have to solve; we have to put statistics and financial models behind it; we have to put algorithms behind it, to work as a team to identify where there are gaps in the process, and solve these issues quickly. In this role you will have a high level of visibility and partner with cross functional teams. We help others understand finance and are the trusted business advisors to our business teams.We are looking for a leader who exhibits excellent attention to detail and is comfortable with ambiguity. The successful candidate will demonstrate an ability to influence business owners, support thoughtful decision-making, and adapt to a rapidly evolving environment. Regular collaboration with executives and various business units across Amazon will allow you the opportunity to exhibit your verbal and written communication skills. A typical day in this role provides an opportunity to improve and create new measures for business effectiveness, innovate creative solutions utilizing large scale data mining tools, and identify high priority projects to maximize results for key stakeholders.Key job responsibilities Delivers weekly/monthly financial close. Utilizes financial systems and advanced BI reporting tools to optimize decision making with large data sets. Outputs plans, forecasts, budgets, and consolidations. Demonstrated ability to root cause issues quickly and uncover core issues using data, then assist, consult with, and teach the business how decisions affect costs or plan in the network and create new mechanisms, as they are needed. Expertise in collecting, analyzing and managing quantitative data to create meaningful analysis to support business improvements through cost optimization. Works with a variety of data sources. Identifies incomplete or inaccurate data, identifies root causes of data issues, escalates discrepancies, fixes data where possible or partners to deliver an automated solution. Lead standardization of network processes to promote consistent and accurate financial reporting including mechanisms to drive adoption. Identifies and implements solutions to resolve, improve, automate, or simplify finance processes. Proven ability to develop strategic relationships with your business partners and influence decisions. Leverage cross-functional partnerships with stakeholders to drive network projects. Makes thoughtful time management decisions independently. Prioritizes work, resolves issues, meets deadlines, and seeks feedback from your manager. Discerns between urgent and non-urgent issues and acts accordingly to solve them. Uses active listening skills intuitively to communicate data (both written and verbal) in a clear, concise, and unambiguous manner. Adjusts style for various audiences to articulate complex finance issues clearly.We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:Arlington, VA, USA | Atlanta, GA, USA | Austin, TX, USA | Bellevue, WA, USA | Dallas, TX, USA | Nashville, TN, USABasic Qualifications BA/BS in Finance, Accounting, Business, Economics, or a highly analytical field (e.g., Engineering, Math, and Computer Science) 3+ years of finance experience or a related analytical fieldPreferred Qualifications MBA, or CPA Knowledge of Tableau Experience working with large-scale data mining and reporting tools (examples: SQL, MS Access, Essbase, Cognos) and other financial systems (examples: Oracle, SAP, Lawson, JD Edwards)Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.
