title: Payroll Senior Analyst
job_description: Inspire Brands is a fast-growing company with significant opportunities for growth and advancement. The company offers a team-oriented culture, dynamic working environment, and work-life balance. As a Sr. Payroll Analyst, you will be responsible for the timely and accurate resolution of complex Payroll issues impacting Restaurant team members. The position is responsible for running pay calculations, completing retroactive calculations, and reviewing and approving final documentation required to be saved for internal/external audit and backup. This role will also coordinate team training and provide support to the Payroll Manager. Successful candidates are passionate and enthusiastic about helping others, eager to learn new skills, and are detail oriented. They enjoy problem solving in a fast-paced environment based in our Atlanta Support Center.ResponsibilitiesPrepare, process, and generate Restaurant payroll via WorkdayAudit, review, and reconcile Restaurant payrolls on a weekly basisReview supporting documentation/backup for weekly audit reports distributed to Payroll CoordinatorsAssists in Training (virtual and in-person) and Development of Payroll Team Members and New HiresResponsible for team-building activities and trainingDocument and maintain best practices, including DLP’s for payroll processing and implement new procedures as neededMaintain a high level of customer service through timely resolution of escalated issuesImport Time and Bonus filesComplete Retroactive payments and audit differencesAssist with research and resolution of complex payroll related mattersMaintain a high level of confidentiality for all payroll-related itemsSupport the Payroll Manager by handling escalations and internal/external auditsCompletes ad hoc projects and other duties as assigned by payroll leadershipEducation & Experience QualificationsHigh school diploma requiredUndergraduate degree in business, accounting, or related field preferredFCP or CPP preferred but not required3 – 5 years of payroll processing experience requiredExperience with Workday or comparable software preferredKnowledge, Skills, and AbilitiesStrong computer skillsIntermediate Microsoft Excel skills: VLOOKUP, Pivot TablesStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsExcellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skillsStrong organizational skills with great attention to detailMust have the ability to work in a fast-paced environment, under pressure, and meet critical deadlinesAbility to work in a highly structured team environmentAbility to maintain strict adherence to outlined proceduresAbility to have a flexible work schedule due to work volume fluctuationsInspire Brands is a multi-brand restaurant company whose portfolio includes nearly 32,000 Arby’s, Baskin-Robbins, Buffalo Wild Wings, Dunkin’, Jimmy John’s, and SONIC Drive-In restaurants worldwide. We’re made up of some of the world’s most iconic restaurant brands, but we’re much more than just a restaurant company. We’re a team of hundreds of thousands who individually and collectively are changing the way people eat, drink, and gather around the table. We know that food is much more than a staple—it’s an experience. At Inspire, that’s our purpose: to ignite and nourish flavorful experiences.

title: Senior System Financial Analyst, Corporate FP&A

In addition, this Analyst will have financial planning, consolidation, reporting, and analysis across all aspects of Corporate Finance. partner with teams to ensure submissions are timely and thoroughSupport consolidation process of multiple planning applications and ensure consolidated financial accuracyCompany expert on Hyperion user troubleshooting, work with finance planning partners and IT support team to resolve issues and remove roadblocks during consolidationSupport postmortem reviews on forecasting cycles, thought partner to Hyperion users and IT support team to simplify processes and implement improvementsCorporate Materials, Reporting & AnalysisPrepare consolidated materials and create executive reporting packages for key meetings and forecast cycles (Monthly Business Review meetings, Leadership Team meetings, Earnings preparation, Board of Directors meetings, and monthly/quarterly reporting)Provide monthly and quarterly variance analyses and periodic P&L updates to accounting and the leadership team, understand drivers / key assumptions and reconcile differences between prior forecasts and prior applicable yearsSimplify processes and automate standard reporting; explore and leverage implement business intelligence tools for reporting (i.e., Tableau, Hyperion)Work directly with Manager and SVP Corporate Finance on development of key deliverables for the CEO:MBR and LT Offsite agendasVP meeting presentationsPriorities / Initiatives for the yearSupport corporate-level reporting and analysis (EPS reconciliation, Historical P&L, Guidance model, Inventory, Inflation, high level operating income reconciliations)Support Corporate initiatives and ad hoc analyses as needed (10%)Support and/or identify new business investments, projects, and other profit improvement opportunities through analysis and business cases (e.g., Little Planet, OshKosh Profitability, other Growth Initiatives)Provide analysis to business leaders in support of projects, new business investments, and other profit or cost reduction opportunitiesProvide back-up support for other finance teams as needed, coordinate with broader FP&A team to provide support and cross train,Ad hoc projects depending on the current needs of the businessWe'd Love to Hear From you if: (Requirements Section)The role requires the ability to manage multiple projects and the ideal candidate must have excellent follow-up and follow through skills3+ years of business analysis experience and finance or accounting experienceStrong understanding of financial processes with experience in accounting and finance principles, applications, and ability to analyze financial statementsExperience with Orcale Hyperion productsProven successful experience in corporate level consolidation activitiesExperience leading and successfully delivering critical projects / initiativesGood interpersonal skills with the ability to build relationships across all levels of the organization. title: Applications Support Analyst II
job_description: Position SummaryFocus is to proactively anticipate and meet user needs while adhering to regulatory requirements and SJ/C Strategic Information Systems goals. The Applications Analyst II has excellent working knowledge of software applications that integrate with those directly being supported. Reviews, analyzes, and modifies application systems to include encoding, testing, troubleshooting, user security access, and installation. The Applications Analyst II works collaboratively with department directors, operations manager, office managers, peers, and business units to evaluate and manage the build, use of applications, and respective interfaces. The Applications Analyst II is responsible for providing advice on systems selection, installation, operation, and on-going support of software applications. Facilitates and leads “go-live” and “upgrade” processes. Serves as project manager on assigned projects and ensures completion on schedule and within budget. Proactively manages change in project scope, identifies potential crises, and devises contingency plans. Serves as resource for other application support analysts by responding to functional questions, assisting with troubleshooting and testing scenarios and monitoring effects of application utilization on provider work flows. Coach, mentor, and motivate Analyst I, vendors and contractors, and influences them to take positive action and accountability for their assigned work. Utilizes exceptional technical writing, communication, presentation skills, and maintains documentation of all changes and decisions. Has a working knowledge of reportable regulatory requirements. Understands data structures and is proficient with translating end user needs. Maintains open communication with practitioners for consultations and assistance. EducationBachelors in Information Systems - Required Experience3 - 5 Years Health systems functional areas or installing/maintaining computer system applications - Required Formal training in information systems, desktop applications, databases, software development packages, and programming languages - PreferredSuccessful completion of training on Microsoft Windows operation system, Office applications, and assigned software applications - PreferredLicense & CertificationNone Required Core Job FunctionsProvides direct support in use of application software to customers including problem resolution, research functionalities, responding to questions and staff training. Ensures software vendors have the information and resources necessary to resolve application problems. Leads projects in one or more aspects of the information systems life cycle (product selection, business requirements definition, communication, implementation, issue resolution, product support). Serves as expert resource and department liaison for ambulatory providers, other analysts and serves as primary liaison between SJ/C users and computer system vendors. Questions on use of system, system flexibility, hardware configurations, functionality and department work flow processes and needs are answered accurately and in timely manner. Coaches Application Support Analysts I toward success by investing time, knowledge transfer, and modeling positive and supportive behaviors that promote team success. Other duties as assigned.Customizes dictionaries, security levels, menus and screen displays according to standard operation procedures. Maintains current and complete documentation of changes for all supported applications. Adheres to change control policies for software modifications. Serves as a member of implementation core teams and provides guidance in planning, coordination and implementation of "go-live" and "upgrade" activities, including project schedule recommendations, training, testing and actual conversion. Provides for continuous on-site support during lives or upgrades. Makes hardware recommendations as necessary and assists with interface testing.Ensures comprehensive software test scenarios are developed to ensure thorough testing of new or upgraded applications prior to "live" date. Reports problems or issues to vendor and in-house staff during testing to ensure timely resolution. Analyzes and resolves problems for ambulatory applications and assists other analysts within the department. Escalates problems outside scope to appropriate person or group. Ensures training has been received for effective application support and end user use. Coordinates and provides the implementation of new or upgraded software applications.Researches and defines user informational needs and work flow processes and translates these needs in order to recommend systems and work flow changes to promote the most effective use of systems and enhancements to user productivity. Recognizes decision level hierarchy, coordinates decisions with other analysts, IS management and ambulatory customers. Has sufficient knowledge of other functions, interfaces and processes to evaluate options beyond those contained within the ambulatory product.

title: Sr. Financial Analyst
job_description: At Berkley Entertainment, we have over 25 years of underwriting risks in Entertainment & Sports.  Our one focus is entertainment insurance. We bring our decades of entertainment experience together to go beyond the basics, providing crafted coverage solutions to protect our clients. Our team’s industry experience and collaborative approach leads to great client solutions — and this is by design. We are here to assist with customizing products and services that are tailored to respond to each client’s unique exposures. The company is an equal employment opportunity employer. Focusing on the insurance business, the Senior Financial Analyst is primarily responsible for assisting with all aspects of the accounting and reporting and the preparation of various components of the company’s financial reporting packages based on US GAAP and Statutory requirements.  Key functions include but are not limited to:Prepares profit and loss statements, and other financial reports. Preparation and analysis of supporting schedules for journal entries in a controlled and timely manner.Participate in the development and maintenance of a chart of accounts and general ledger as well as company accounting policy and administer approved accounting procedures.Create various financial analysis and present findings to managers and/or executives.Coordinate, compile, and review SOX related activities for the business unit. Bachelor’s degree in business or related field required, and in accounting preferred.Public accounting experience and CPA and/or advanced degree preferred. Minimum 5 years of insurance industry preferred and annual statement preparation, financial accounting, and financial reporting experience required. Experience with financial statement software, Hyperion software or other large ERP systems, and proficiency with Microsoft products preferred. Experience with reinsurance, international insurance, and related functions preferred.Excellent communication skills, professional in attitude and appearance and should be highly attentive to detail required.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
job_description: Position Title:  Senior Financial Analyst Reports to:  Director of Finance Location:  1720 Peachtree Industrial Blvd Suite A, Buford, GA 30518 FLSA Status:  Exempt CATALYST NUTRACEUTICALS  is engaged in manufacturing dietary supplements of only the highest quality, setting industry standards every step of the way. We feel a responsibility for every product we make. Our company has grown by building—and maintaining—solid relationships. We work as a team with our employees, our customers, and the industry. We draw heavily on the expertise of all our trusted ingredient suppliers, vendors, printers, testing labs and others to ensure we stay at the forefront of industry trends—delivering the best in pricing and quality. It’s not just good sense, it’s good business.General Job DescriptionWe are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Financial Analyst to join our team. As a Senior Financial Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing financial data, assessing growth and improvement opportunities, and providing strategic financial guidance to the organization. You will play a key role in evaluating financial performance, identifying trends, and making recommendations that drive business growth and profitability.Essential Job Duties & Responsibilities Partner with and assist the manufacturing sales organization in analyzing new opportunities and assessing actual results against expectations.  Assist in conducting profitability and budget variance analyses for both the manufacturing and brands organizations  Assist in preparing financial reports, including monthly financial statements, for senior management and stakeholders  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop forecasts and budgets  Assist in monthly close process, including some journal entries, billing, and inventory reconciliations  Participate in financial audits, ensuring compliance with regulations and identifying areas for improvement Education & Experience Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field; Master's degree preferred  At least five (5) years experience in an accounting- or finance-related role, preferably in a manufacturing environment; 1-2 years cost accounting highly desirable  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to gather, analyze, and interpret financial and operational data  Advanced proficiency in financial modeling and forecasting techniques  Proficient in financial analysis software and MS Office suite, especially Excel and PowerPoint  Experience with and broad exposure to integrated ERP environments (Deacom a plus)  Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex financial information to non-financial stakeholders  Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with the ability to meet strict deadlines  Employment Eligibility Verification Must possess valid documentation to establish identity and U.S. employment eligibility. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Safety Responsibility Statement Supports a culture of safe production and operations; follows all safety rules and procedures. Actively participates in the safety program by: engaging in training activities to learn what constitutes a safety hazard; reporting safety concerns to the manager, submitting safety suggestions, and correcting or reporting to the appropriate people when an employee sees a workplace health or safety hazard, until it is resolved. Assists with communicating safety information to new employees. Fulfills responsibilities as outlined in the company safety management plan.Security RequirementsSubmission to, and ability to pass, a thorough pre-employment background check by Catalyst is a requirement of employment. Catalyst is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: MES Senior Systems Analyst
job_description: Requirements Description & Requirements WestRock (NYSE :WRK) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to more fiber-based packaging forward.Our technology organization is transforming how we work at WestRock. We align with our businesses to deliver innovative solutions that:Address specific business challenges, integrate processes, and create great experiencesConnect our work to shared goals that propel WestRock forward in the Digital AgeImagine how technology can advance the way we work by using disruptive technology We are looking for forward thinking technologists that can accelerate our focus areas such as building stronger foundational technology capabilities, reducing complexity, employing digital transformation concepts, and leveraging disruptive technology.The OpportunityWestRock has embarked on the One WestRock Business Systems Transformation initiative, a multi-year program aligned to our Path to One goals to become the world’s best paper and packaging company by 2025. The MES Sr. System Analyst position is a part of our IT and Digital Business Systems Transformation technology team responsible for the overall technology Manufacturing Execution System (MES) workstream.This role will serve as a trusted partner, advisor and thought leader on the future state technology landscape (ERP and legacy systems environment), and systems implementation.This position will be responsible for maximizing the use of MES system at our paper mill locations to optimize our production processes, leveraging their expertise in MES implementation, administration, and support. We are looking for an experienced MES Sr. System Analyst to join our team with a strong focus on implementing and supporting Manufacturing Execution System (MES). They will have exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail and a track record of delivering successful MES solutions. If you are passionate about driving operational excellence through technology, we'd love to hear from you.How You Will Impact WestRockWork directly on development of MES Systems and interfaces, providing technical leadership, coordinate with other resources and create high quality products within the defined schedules and budgets.MES project implementation, analyzing and gathering requirements and propose appropriate solutions for MES projects.Becoming proficient at supporting, installing, configuring, developing MES Systems and interfaces, workflow process, troubleshooting the software and staying current with upgrades, updates, and patches.Provide system application support including troubleshooting, design analysis and system configurationProvide 24/7 application support in manufacturing environmentWork with business personnel and implementation team members to understand business needs, identify, design, and implement technology solutions to improve efficiency and effectiveness of business processes.Document related business processes, document MES system configurations and design, develop end-user instructions, develop training material along with training end users.Identify improvement opportunities, work with key users to develop improvement plans, manage the plans, test, and implement.Provide project management services for small-to-medium projects related to the MES Systems and related projects.Provide data analysis and problem solving / troubleshooting services. Work with internal WestRock IT personnel and external contractors, where required, to deliver needed functionality. Establish solid and effective working relationships in a fast-paced environment.Become knowledgeable of other WestRock systems as required to effectively support the business processes that interact with the MES System.What You Need To SucceedExperience with the following is required:Understanding of Microsoft SQL Server writing complex stored procedures and expressions Understanding of Microsoft SQL SSRS or Crystal ReportsPaper industry roll handling/tracking and inventory applicationsExperience with any or all the following is desired:Shop floor applicationsKnowledge of DCS/PLC/SCADA Knowledge on TCP IP, OPC and FTP Protocol.Experience with report creation, maintenance, metrics, scorecardsHoneywell Optivision and Optimizer, Majiq Elixir, Panther Systems Mill Tools and Test CentralKnowledge of help desk software and help desk processes.Familiar with running a mission critical application in a high availability environment.Familiar with Agile / Scrum processes.Ability to travel approximately 25%College degree or minimum equivalent work experience of 10 years in IT, Engineering or paper mill operations business.What We OfferCorporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability and excellenceComprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunitiesAn attractive salary reflecting skills, competencies and potentialA career with a global packaging company where Sustainability , Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work. WestRock is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to create and maintain a diverse workforce where everyone feels valued, respected, and included. WestRock does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
job_description: JAS is an international, non-asset-based supply chain services and solutions company. Our services include air and ocean freight forwarding, contract logistics, customs brokerage, distribution, inbound logistics, truckload brokerage and other supply chain management services, including consulting, the coordination of purchase orders and customized management services.The Senior Financial Analyst is a high performing self-starter with strong work ethic. This role is responsible for providing insightful financial analysis in relation to the monthly financial close. Key deliverables include providing accurate, timely and relevant financial reporting and forecasting support to Management.Financial Reporting Essential Functions:Prepare and provide financial statements and reporting packages monthly.Provide detailed, timely, and accurate analysis for month-end and quarter close results review vs budget, forecast, and prior year.Understand and analyze the impact of foreign currency and translation impact on the financial results.Perform variance analysis and communicate key issues and trends.Coordinate with Regions and Management companies to analyze and report accurate forecasts.Special projects and analysis as assigned.Other:Communicate, research, and resolve subsidiary and regional inquiries related to US GAAP and company policy.Support year-end audit with international subsidiaries and regional offices. Collaborate with IT on reporting software updates and developments related to system upgrades, financial reporting, and required improvements. Responsible for performing special projects to improve process efficiency and performance.Support regions and subsidiaries to address reporting and training needs.Propose process improvement solutions for system applications.Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting, MBA or CPA a plus4-6 years of experience in Finance or Accounting preferably 3 years in a Financial Analyst role in a multi-national companyWorking knowledge of US GAAPUnderstanding of Foreign Currency TranslationsStrong Excel skills requiredExcellent organizational skills, problem-solving skills, and communication skills.Ability to manage multiple priorities utilizing strong analytical skills.Able to work efficiently with minimum supervision and within tight time constraints. Financial Systems such as Workday Financials, Adaptive, and CargoWise One preferred Mergers & Acquisition experience a plusThe ideal candidate:Will be able to work with large data sets, perform data mining, and possess excellent skills in Excel and report writing.Is detail oriented, works with a sense of urgency, takes initiative, and can work through multiple tasks and meet deadlines.Is a critical thinker and able to apply their knowledge and expertise to thoroughly analyze financial performance to provide insightful narrative analysis to support decision-making.Has excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills, to resolve clearly express reporting needs and with the ability to apply knowledge and expertise to support decision-making. ENVIRONMENT: 100% performed in climate-controlled internal office environment working under normal office conditions. Travel will be (up to 10%) required in support of the position’s responsibilities. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; stand; walk; use hands and finger to feel and handle; reach with arms and hands; talk and hear. While performing the duties of this job, the employee frequently is required to stoop, kneel, and crouch; lift weight or exert a force up to a maximum of 25 pounds.ADDITIONAL: The responsibilities associated with this job will change from time to time in accordance with the Company’s business needs. More specifically, the incumbent may be required to perform additional and/or different responsibilities from those set forth above.The above declarations are not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job described, nor are they intended to be such a listing of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Rather, they are intended only to describe the general nature of the job.DEFINITIONS: (if any abbreviation, the meaning needs to be inserted)Management retains discretion to add or change duties of this position at any time JAS Forwarding (USA), Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, disability, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, sexual orientation, age, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.Where required by state law and/or city ordinance; this employer will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization.NOTICE TO APPLICANTSJAS USA IS A CUSTOMS BROKER, GOVERNED BY FEDERAL REGULATION. FEDERAL REGULATIONS PROVIDE THAT JAS MAY HAVE IT BROKERAGE LICENSE SUSPENDED OR REVOKED IF IT “KNOWINGLY EMPLOYED, OR CONTINUES TO EMPLOY, ANY PERSON WHO HAS BEEN CONVICTED OF A FELONY, WITHOUT WRITTEN APPROVAL OF THAT EMPLOYMENT FROM THE ASSISTANT COMMISSIONER.” JAS WILL PERFORM A BACKGROUND CHECK TO DETERMINE IF YOU HAVE BEEN CONVICTED OF A FELONY AND IF SO, ABSENT SPECIAL CIRCUMSTANCES, YOU WILL NOT BE HIRED OR WILL BE TERMINATED IMMEDIATELY.

title: Salesforce Cloud Contact Center Specialist
job_description: Job Description:      We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Salesforce Cloud Contact Center Specialist to join our dynamic team.      In this role, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining Salesforce Cloud Contact Center solutions to enhance our customer service operations.     The ideal candidate should have a strong background in Salesforce, contact center technologies, and excellent problem-solving skills.      Responsibilities:     Salesforce Implementation: Design, configure, and implement Salesforce Cloud Contact Center solutions to meet business requirements.     Customize and optimize Salesforce features such as Omni-Channel, CTI (Computer Telephony Integration), and Service Cloud to improve contact center efficiency.      Integration:     Integrate Salesforce with other systems and platforms to ensure seamless data flow and a unified customer experience.     Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement and maintain integration solutions.      Custom Development:     Develop custom functionalities and features in Salesforce to address unique contact center needs.     Write Apex code, Visualforce pages, and Lightning components as required.      User Training and Support:     Provide training to contact center agents and other users on Salesforce tools and features.     Offer ongoing support to troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Salesforce Cloud Contact Center.      Analytics and Reporting:     Create and maintain reports and dashboards to track key contact center metrics.     Analyze data to identify trends, areas for improvement, and make recommendations for optimization.      Qualifications:     Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.     Salesforce certifications such as Salesforce Certified Administrator and Salesforce Certified Service Cloud Consultant.     Proven experience in implementing and customizing Salesforce Cloud Contact Center solutions.     Familiarity with contact center technologies such as CTI, IVR (Interactive Voice Response), and ACD (Automatic Call Distribution).     Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.      Skills:     Proficiency in Salesforce configuration and customization.     Knowledge of Apex, Visualforce, and Lightning components.     Experience with integration tools and technologies.     Understanding of contact center best practices and industry trends.      Strong project management skills.     Business Analyst along with any of the below listed toolset experience.     Quadient Inspire designer (Previously called GMC).     Quadient Interactive.     Message Point.     Adobe Creative Suite.      #monsterit

title: Senior Data Analyst
job_description: Job Description:  Responsibilities:      Perform job responsibilities with minimal supervision.     Extract primary data from Oracle Database with the use of SQL.     Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.     Provide timely and accurate data to fulfill internal and external data requests.     Identify, compile, and ‘clean’ data for research projects.     Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.     Oversee evaluation and research projects.     Communicate the evaluation plan and its details to leadership and stakeholders.     Collaborate with external research partners to ensure understanding of data points and data sets.     Develop and monitor internal and external data requests.     Manage, summarize, and analyze quantitative and qualitative data.     Summarize and explain research findings and their implications.     Prepare findings for publication.     Develop, review, and abstract published research.     Produce data visualization dashboards with Tableau.      Qualification:     Bachelor's degree in a related field from an accredited college or university AND Two years in a related lead or supervisory role OR Associate's degree in a related field from an accredited college or university AND Four years of related experience, Two years of which in a related lead or supervisory role OR Two years of experience at the lower level IT Business Analyst or position equivalent.     Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL, Oracle, etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks).     Significant experience in accessing and extracting data from organizational and other institutional databases.     Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.     2+ years of relevant work experience in the Criminal Justice field and Data Management/Analysis.     Proficient skills in queries, report writing, and presenting findings.     Experience in data visualization software (i.e., Tableau).

title: Senior Help Desk Analyst
job_description: Job Description:  Responsibilities:     Demonstrated experience with Service Desk application for managing IT requests.     Demonstrated ability to support and troubleshoot laptops, desktops, IP Phones, cell phones, and various applications.     Serve as the first point of contact for end-users seeking technical support via phone, email, and chat channels.      Ticket concerns will be IT in nature and related to systems, software, or hardware.     Monitor and respond quickly and effectively to requests received through the Helpdesk ticket board and escalate unresolved issues to the next level of support.     Perform basic remote or in-person troubleshooting by walking customers through problem-solving processes and probing questions.     Utilize excellent customer service skills to build rapport with end-users and maintain positive client communication.     Ability to correctly assess a situation, come up with a logical resolution and seek assistance if required.     Must be able to multitask in a Microsoft Windows environment and utilize multiple programs for troubleshooting.     Must be a flexible, independent, self-motivated problem solver who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment.     MS Office and Microsoft 365 troubleshooting experience.     VPN remote access configuration & troubleshooting experience.     Demonstrated experience troubleshooting infrastructure and network-related issues.     Coordinate directly with business owners, development teams, 3rd party vendors, and supporting organizations to best understand and analyze business specifications.     Responsible for maintaining Active Directory accounts (activating, de-activating, creating, and managing AD user groups and security levels.     Familiar with SharePoint, Teams, and OneDrive.     Have a basic knowledge of Azure.     Excellent customer service skills and the ability to communicate effectively in oral and written form with technical and non-technical clients.     Ability to work independently with staff on processes and simple software solutions.      Qualifications:     Associate's degree in a related field from an accredited college or university.     Two years of experience at the lower-level Help Desk Analyst 1 or position equivalent.

title: Senior HRIS Analyst
job_description: The salary range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs.At WGU, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role, and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is:Pay Range: $105,600.00 - $158,400.00If you’re passionate about building a better future for individuals, communities, and our country—and you’re committed to working hard to play your part in building that future—consider WGU as the next step in your career.Driven by a mission to expand access to higher education through online, competency-based degree programs, WGU is also committed to being a great place to work for a diverse workforce of student-focused professionals. The university has pioneered a new way to learn in the 21st century, one that has received praise from academic, industry, government, and media leaders. Whatever your role, working for WGU gives you a part to play in helping students graduate, creating a better tomorrow for themselves and their families.Internal Application Deadline is Tuesday, April 30th***The Senior HRIS Analyst will act as the Workday technical lead, subject matter expert and advisor, providing HCM system administration and support and leading Workday HCM system configuration, enhancement, and deployment efforts. Additionally, this individual will serve as the liaison between business teams, third party vendors and EdTech (IT) for system integrations, enhancements, and issue fixes. The Senior HRIS Analyst will demonstrate high proficiency in project management, communication with leadership and stakeholders, as well as system knowledge, process analysis, and configuration abilities.Essential Functions and Responsibilities: Lead work to configure, enhance, and support various Workday modules including HCM, Advanced Compensation, Recruiting, Talent/Performance, HCM integrations, etc.Manage and administer Workday security groups, foundational tables, and Workday inbound and outbound HCM integrations.Partner and consult closely with leaders, business and support teams to understand system end-user needs and provide recommendations to keep Workday business processes simple and efficient. Communicate system related enhancements, releases, and upgrades.Lead continuous improvement projects, such as improving Workday processes, workflows, integrations, and data integrity.Ensure accuracy and integrity of organizational data within the HCM.Manage Workday releases and updates, which includes researching functionality, conducting testing, and communicating options for changes or enhancements, as applicable.Provide end-user troubleshooting, issue remediation, technology request assistance and escalation management, using ticketing and/or tracking systems. Monitor reoccurring issues, system/data or process gaps and proactively identify potential sources of increased efficiency and enhancements.Broaden internal knowledge of Workday through job aids and other training materials.Regularly support People and Talent initiatives and projects by researching technology solutions and executing deliverables on time.Work closely with other team members to brainstorm, strategize and complete ad hoc requests creatively, effectively, and efficiently.Serve as a subject matter expert, mentor team members, and assist with training new team members.Complete other duties as assigned.Knowledge, Skill and Abilities:Knowledge of HR systems maintenance and support, including the execution of system changes (updates, integrations, new configurations) and system testing.Practical knowledge of verifying data for import into systems or for use in reports, spreadsheets, graphs, and/or flow charts.Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office, especially Excel.Must be a detail-oriented thinker, exhibiting strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills.Team player that contributes valuable ideas and feedback and can be counted on to meet commitments.Ability to work cross-functionally within People and Talent as well as effectively interact with other departments.Work effectively in the face of ambiguity, shifting priorities and rapid change.Effective listening, written, and verbal communication skills.Ability to work with sensitive employee data, maintaining confidentiality in all situations with a keen eye for detail, quality, and accuracy.Knowledge of general human resources practices, policies, and procedures.Competencies: Organizational or Student Impact:Follows technical/ business processes; helps support change when necessary.Executes complex, specialized technical projects/assignments.Responsible for major or many components in the area of expertise.Limit errors to prevent impact to client operations, costs, or schedules.Problem Solving & Decision Making:Meets goals with little direction/supervision.Leads key technical projects and programs. May facilitate leadership and development of technical teams.Drives project methods, techniques, and procedures.Communication & Influence:Communicates with parties within and outside of the university (e.g., customers, vendors, etc.)Works to influence parties within and outside of the job function at an operational level regarding policies, procedures, and practices.Leadership & Talent Management:May be responsible for providing guidance, coaching and training to other employees within technical area.May be responsible for managing major/complex technical projects at this level, involving delegation of work and review of work products.Job Qualifications:Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent experience) in a human resources, computer science, information systems or related discipline.5-7 years of human resources and/or data analytics related experience as well as project coordination/management experience.Experience with configuring and maintaining HRIS/HCM systems.Experience leading HRIS projects including implementations, integration builds, functionality enhancements, and process improvement initiatives.Preferred Qualifications:Two or more years of Workday experience preferred.Workday Pro Certification (HCM, Studio, Integrations, Core Connectors, etc.) a plus.PHR certification a plus.Physical Requirements:Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Occcasional travel for team and/or department meetings.As an equal opportunity employer, WGU recognizes that our strength lies in our people. We are committed to diversity.

title: Payroll Tax Analyst
job_description: About NCR VOYIXNCR VOYIX Corporation (NYSE: VYX) is a leading global provider of digital commerce solutions for the retail, restaurant and banking industries. NCR VOYIX is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, with approximately 16,000 employees in 35 countries across the globe. For nearly 140 years, we have been the global leader in consumer transaction technologies, turning everyday consumer interactions into meaningful moments. Today, NCR VOYIX transforms the stores, restaurants and digital banking experiences with cloud-based, platform-led SaaS and services capabilities.Not only are we the leader in the market segments we serve and the technology we deliver, but we create exceptional consumer experiences in partnership with the world’s leading retailers, restaurants and financial institutions. We leverage our expertise, R&D capabilities and unique platform to help navigate, simplify and run our customers’ technology systems.Our customers are at the center of everything we do. Our mission is to enable stores, restaurants and financial institutions to exceed their goals – from customer satisfaction to revenue growth, to operational excellence, to reduced costs and profit growth. Our solutions empower our customers to succeed in today’s competitive landscape.Our unique perspective brings innovative, industry-leading tech to all the moving parts of business across industries. NCR VOYIX has earned the trust of businesses large and small — from the best-known brands around the world to your local favorite around the corner.The Senior Payroll Tax Analyst is responsible for ensuring the Company’s ongoing compliance with all federal, state, and local tax laws and regulations. This individual is responsible for analyzing, researching, and resolving issues and addressing related tax inquiries. This individual will specialize in payroll regulatory compliance across all states in which employees reside. This individual may also work with partners in Accounting, Human Resources, Third Party Vendors, and other internal departments on various initiatives.Position Summary and Key Areas of Responsibility:Serve as an escalation point and Subject Matter Expert (SME) for complex payroll and tax issues.Responsible for ensuring the execution of quarter and year-end process is completed – Run payroll tax integrations, research, correct discrepancies and prepare reconciliations.Responsible for ensuring the execution of monthly, quarterly, and annual worker’s comp audit and tax incentive requests.Responsible for the completion of the amendment processing.RSU processing including pre-payments/reversals, running integrations, researching, and correcting tax variances.Responsible for timely and accurate posting of all payroll-related journal entries for month end close in accordance with the organizations' month end close schedule, policies, and procedures.Create and maintain complex reports from Workday and other systems.Assist with the planning and implementation of projects and system testing.Act as a mentor to other payroll team members, providing training, support and guidance on projects, tasks, and troubleshooting.Ability to identify complex issues and demonstrate curiosity to investigate and resolve.Performs maintenance on payroll tax updates and is responsible for testing new or changed payroll tax functionality, providing detailed design and program specifications.Proactively assess, refine, and implement Payroll tax process improvements and tools, including requirements, system design, data flows, interfaces, testing, validation, documentation, and team training.Ability to initiate and lead conversations to drive payroll projects and issue resolutions, including directing work of team members.Assists in setting goals for department around objectives and projects.Maintain and help drive innovations and execution to support accurate and efficient day-to-day operations.Research laws and regulation changes and how they affect the payroll system and processes.Support Payroll management and team members with projects and other tasks as required. Basic Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or relevant field. An appropriate combination of education and work experience will be considered.5+ years related experience processing high volume, multi-state payroll for a mid to large size company.5+ years related experience in payroll tax and accounting.Hands on and strong knowledge/experience with ADP Smart Compliance and Workday.Understanding of federal and state regulations related to salaries, wages, taxes, benefits, and other payroll related matters required.Understanding of payroll accounting.Consistently achieves goals by prioritizing work and resources appropriately.Superior organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks.Advanced Microsoft office skills (Excel, Word)Able to work independently.Able to work in a high growth environment under tight deadlines.Excellent interpersonal skills and able to work collaboratively.FPC or CPP certification preferred.Offers of employment are conditional upon passage of screening criteria applicable to the jobEEO StatementIntegrated into our shared values is NCR Voyix’s commitment to diversity and equal employment opportunity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, age, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, military service, genetic information, or any other characteristic or conduct protected by law. NCR Voyix is committed to being a globally inclusive company where all people are treated fairly, recognized for their individuality, promoted based on performance and encouraged to strive to reach their full potential. We believe in understanding and respecting differences among all people. Every individual at NCR Voyix has an ongoing responsibility to respect and support a globally diverse environment.Statement to Third Party AgenciesTo ALL recruitment agencies: NCR Voyix only accepts resumes from agencies on the preferred supplier list. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, NCR Voyix employees, or any NCR Voyix facility. NCR Voyix is not responsible for any fees or charges associated with unsolicited resumes“When applying for a job, please make sure to only open emails that you will receive during your application process that come from a @ncrvoyix.com email domain.”

title: Quality Assurance Analyst
job_description: Job Description:        Responsibilities:      Works on multiple projects/applications as a project team member.      Considered a subject matter expert for several projects/applications.      Works on projects of moderate to high complexity within one + development environments.      The Senior BA/QA work with software developers and business customers to ensure that the business needs are met by the systems being built, changed, enhanced, or purchased.     Develops formal test plans and test cases.       This includes writing, maintaining, and executing functional, regression, and integration test scripts based on requirements documentation.       At times, may develop automation of test cases.     Identify procedures and scenarios for the quality control of products and services.     Process product reviews and inform the development team of defects and errors.     Communicate quantitative and qualitative findings from test results to the development team.     Creates, tracks, maintains, and verifies defects via a defect management system.     Ensure that the final product satisfies the product requirements and meets end-user expectations.      Utilizes the Following Testing Methods:     Exploratory.     Verification/Validation.     Regression.     Spot areas for improvement to enhance the product's efficiency.     Research the current market for similar products and compare results.     Participates in customer meetings as well as project team meetings.     Participates in project team meetings during multiple phases of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC).     Communicates testing results to team members and stakeholders. Helps guide customers, maintain defect logs, and answer questions during User Acceptance Testing.     With minimal direction, selects and effectively uses tools that support test plans and test processes.     Performs all other duties as assigned.      Core Competencies:     3 years of demonstrated experience in providing QA testing for complex web solutions (websites) manual and automated.     2 years of demonstrated experience testing web solutions in an enterprise environment with external customers.     2 years of demonstrated experience testing web solutions in a Drupal 8/9/10 environment.     2 years of experience developing, updating, and executing automated test scripts.     2 years experience with Selenium testing tools.     2 years of manual regression testing experience.     2 years experience working with Jira and Confluence.     Oral and written communication skills.     Interpersonal, consultive, and facilitation skills.     Critical Analysis Skills.     Problem-Solving Skills.     Technical Awareness of the project.     Management and Leadership Skills.     Keen attention to detail.      Agency-Specific Qualifications:  Minimum Education/Experience:        Bachelor's degree in computer science or information systems or proven equivalent work experience, AND three (3) years of systems analysis and/or business analysis experience, AND two (2) + years experience in documentation, quality assurance, integration, and user acceptance testing OR 4 years demonstrated experience as a hands-on QA specialist.      Preferred Qualifications:     Advanced level experience in software development methodologies, like Agile, Scrum, and Waterfall.     Experience working in state government.

title: Engineering Process Quality Assurance Analyst I
job_description: ***Upcoming Master's Degree graduates will be considered. Degree must be conferred prior to beginning employment.***Engineering Process Quality Assurance Analyst I in GAC SavannahUnique SkillsThis is an analyst position requiring experience with quality assurance, process evaluation, and continuous improvement philosophies, methodologies, and practices. A successful candidate will be able to: Support the implementation of the current Engineering Process Quality Assurance program  Execute assessments across critical business areas, primarily within the Engineering organization  Initiate thorough research and reporting of potential process risk and action plans for improvement  Proactively address negative trends that may expose the organization to regulatory findings  Interface with primary process owners regarding assessments, risks, and findings In Addition, The Successful Candidate Will Be Able To Support knowledge management through the organization's operational business processes and systems identifying and pursuing opportunities to connect knowledge sharing and the information systems; focus on improving integration among information systems in the organization to push toward seamless exchange of information across the organization.  Support priorities and expectations for knowledge sharing through communication, engagement/participation, and report on progress and measures of knowledge management elements.  Support employee expectations for knowledge sharing by communicating about knowledge management initiatives, progress, best practices, and opportunities for participation cross the organization. Required Experience with value-stream mapping, business process management, and statistical analysis.  Proficiency with a process mapping tool such as Microsoft Visio.  Experience with SharePoint 2016, or later. Preferred Green belt and/or Black belt certifications.  Experience with the ISO 9000-series quality assurance standards.  Experience using work management tools such as OneNote, DevOps, Jira, or similar. Education And Experience RequirementsBachelor's Degree Engineering or Related STEM curriculum required or equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Experience credit considered for related adv degrees limited to 2 yrs for Masters and 4 yrs for PhD in fields applicable to this job. 8 years engineering, research, development test and evaluation technology programs, and or project development and management. 5 years related experience that includes process quality/process improvementengineering, research, development test and evaluation technology programs, and or project development and management.. Master's Degree preferred. Position Purpose:As part of the Gulfstream Engineering team, assists with all of the engineering and technical and business operations processes, tools, and audit related activities. These may be department or discipline specific or cross-functional spanning across Gulfstream Engineering and through other parts of the Innovation, Engineering and Flight (IEF) organization.Job DescriptionPrinciple Duties and Responsibilities:Essential Functions: Contributes to and assists in the development and integration of strategic workflow for engineering policies, processes and work procedures, including Corporate and Program Directives; engineering design as embodied in the Gulfstream Engineering Manual and subordinate work methods; and engineering business operations. Provides assistance to teams of technical staff and other subject matter experts to understand engineering process requirements and improvement opportunities. Interacts with appropriate technical resources to aid in the evaluation and development of engineering and IEF policies, procedures and strategies for complying with Gulfstream requirements. Coordinate/lead discussions with Gulfstream engineering technical personnel primarily, and key SME’s from other areas of the business as needed. Leads work teams including cross-functional process improvement teams to develop engineering processes, procedures, and standards and ensure their implementation. Participates in the development, deployment, and integration of all engineering electronic tools related to business process/content management and standards delivery. Provides expertise, information, and proposed actions on engineering process and tools requirements and issues related to engineering activities.Perform other duties as assigned.Other Requirements: Advanced degree/certification in engineering or business/operations discipline (e.g., Project Control, Project/Program Management, Operations Research, Engineering Management) or related curriculum preferred.  Systems Engineering and multi-disciplinary integration certification or work experience highly preferred. Some examples of certification for this experience are: SAE ARP4754, INCOSE, Defense Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act (DAWIA) Systems Engineering.  Lean Six Sigma (LSS) Greenbelt, or equivalent, certification preferred.  Experience with “no-code” software development, such as workflows, business process modeling, simulation, etc.  Experience with Microsoft Project, and Sharepoint collaboration experience preferred.  Proficiency with a process mapping tool such as Microsoft Visio, or other Business Process Management suite. Additional InformationRequisition Number: 219554Category: EngineeringPercentage of Travel: Up to 25%Shift: FirstEmployment Type: Full-timePosting End Date: 04/30/2024Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled.Gulfstream does not provide work visa sponsorship for this position, unless the applicant is a currently sponsored Gulfstream employee.Copyright © 2024 Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation. All Rights Reserved.Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation, a wholly-owned subsidiary of General Dynamics (NYSE: GD), designs, develops, manufactures, markets, services and supports the world's most technologically-advanced business jet aircraft
Industries: Airlines and Aviation and Aviation and Aerospace Component Manufacturing

title: Senior Payroll Compliance Analyst
job_description: About NCR VOYIXNCR VOYIX Corporation (NYSE: VYX) is a leading global provider of digital commerce solutions for the retail, restaurant and banking industries. NCR VOYIX is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, with approximately 16,000 employees in 35 countries across the globe. For nearly 140 years, we have been the global leader in consumer transaction technologies, turning everyday consumer interactions into meaningful moments. Today, NCR VOYIX transforms the stores, restaurants and digital banking experiences with cloud-based, platform-led SaaS and services capabilities.Not only are we the leader in the market segments we serve and the technology we deliver, but we create exceptional consumer experiences in partnership with the world’s leading retailers, restaurants and financial institutions. We leverage our expertise, R&D capabilities and unique platform to help navigate, simplify and run our customers’ technology systems.Our customers are at the center of everything we do. Our mission is to enable stores, restaurants and financial institutions to exceed their goals – from customer satisfaction to revenue growth, to operational excellence, to reduced costs and profit growth. Our solutions empower our customers to succeed in today’s competitive landscape.Our unique perspective brings innovative, industry-leading tech to all the moving parts of business across industries. NCR VOYIX has earned the trust of businesses large and small — from the best-known brands around the world to your local favorite around the corner.Title: Senior Payroll Compliance AnalystLocation: Atlanta, GASummaryAs a Global Payroll Compliance Analyst, you will work closely with the Global Payroll Regional Leads to provide support, guidance, and continuous training on payroll compliance in North America, LATAM, EMEA & APAC.Serve as the subject matter expert on Global Payroll compliance policies, procedures, and programs to ensure that they meet legal and regulatory requirements.Partner with internal legal team to produce interpretations of findings as well as recommendations on changes to existing policies and systems.Partner with HRIS/IT to manage system updates related to regulatory changes, statutory reporting and ensure time and attendance rules are accurately configured to comply with country specific wage and hours laws and collective bargaining agreements. Perform duties as a test lead and execute tests related to payroll compliance.Partner with Finance to ensure compliance with General Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and working with Finance teams to ensure journal entries and reconciliations are completed accurately and according to Finance close schedules. Create and maintain a compliance tracker that can be use dot report to HR leadership on compliance status, proposed improvements, and impending legislative changes.Partner with Payroll Tax Analyst and Corporate Tax to ensure compliance with payroll taxes and taxes reporting.Stay informed about changes in wage and hour laws, regulations, and industry standards that may impact Payroll policies.Collaborate with relevant stakeholders to address potential compliance challenges and ensure proactive measures are in place.May partners with external consultants to gain expert advice where necessary.Update policies as necessary to reflect changes in legal requirements and mitigate compliance risks.Partner with Internal audit to define and modify internal controls and conduct regular audits of payroll records to identify and mitigate risks.Address additional compliance issues that may impact payroll taxes and processing such as state leave laws and insurance entitlements.Partner with data privacy teams to ensure adherence to CCPA, GDPR regulations and policies.Educate the business and local payroll teams with regards to compliance and processesContinuously evaluate, implement best practices, streamline operations, enhance payroll, and tax processes for efficiency and accuracy.May act as the back-up support end to end US/Canada payroll processing on a biweekly & weekly basis.RequirementsBachelor’s degree in HR, Finance or Business AdministrationMinimum 5 years of North America payroll experience with 2 years of international experienceCertified Payroll Professional Certification (CPP) a plusAdvanced working knowledge of Microsoft ExcelExperience with payroll application such WorkdayWell-organized, extreme attention to detail and a self-directed individualDeep knowledge of current rules, regulations, laws, principles, and practices related to global payroll processing.Deep knowledge of wage and hour and tax regulations such as FLSA, FICA, EPA, FUTA and general laws and regulations regarding taxes globallyKnowledge accounting principles and data protection and privacy lawsKnowledge of technologies, system implementations and ability to recommend changes or improvements to existing processes or systems.Knowledge of preparing documentation for government audits and annual filings.Knowledge of advanced auditing and monitoring techniques required to ensure compliance.Strong critical thinking, problem solving and analytical skills.Strong focus on customer service.Strong sense of urgency.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Offers of employment are conditional upon passage of screening criteria applicable to the jobEEO StatementIntegrated into our shared values is NCR Voyix’s commitment to diversity and equal employment opportunity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, age, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, military service, genetic information, or any other characteristic or conduct protected by law. NCR Voyix is committed to being a globally inclusive company where all people are treated fairly, recognized for their individuality, promoted based on performance and encouraged to strive to reach their full potential. We believe in understanding and respecting differences among all people. Every individual at NCR Voyix has an ongoing responsibility to respect and support a globally diverse environment.Statement to Third Party AgenciesTo ALL recruitment agencies: NCR Voyix only accepts resumes from agencies on the preferred supplier list. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, NCR Voyix employees, or any NCR Voyix facility. title: Finance Leadership Development Program
job_description: We are looking for an early professional to join our Finance Leadership Development Program at Innomotics – A Siemens Business. Your change engine.Motors and drives are our business, redefining reliable motion from check-time per day to uptime per lifecycle, from simply on/off to everything smart in between. Our most powerful engine: more than 15,000 dedicated experts, doers, colleagues. For them, engineering the future means keeping businesses in motion – in e-motion. We are the “we” in power – and we can empower you.15,000 and counting.Are you looking for the stability of an established global player with the lean, innovative spirit of a mid-size hidden champion? That’s us! Are you looking to shape entire industries with a future-proof portfolio of more sustainable, energy efficient solutions? Deal, let’s go!The role.What is the Finance Leadership Development Program?The Finance Leadership Development Program (FLDP) prepares you to support a wide range of businesses as a financial leader in our organization. You will learn what it takes to analyze and manage the financial aspects of a company ranked among the top 50 in sales in the world.The FLDP is a two-year rotational program, with four six-month assignments (hybrid working), where participants will be exposed to several finance topics, such as cost accounting, financial analysis, performance controlling and reporting, project controlling, amongst others. You will be equipped with the necessary tools and knowledge to thrive in your respective role as you receive mentoring from Siemens’ team of business leaders, gain access to and network with Siemens senior decision-makers, and learn the overall strategy, systems, and accomplishments that make this company a global leader. Upon completion of the program, graduates should transition into roles such as Financial Analyst, Order/Contract Administrator, Factory Costing Expert, or Project Controller. Program Start Date: July 2024 What are the Potential Experiences?Here are a few examples of what you will experience during the FLDP:Performance Controlling/Financial Analysis Perform monthly reporting analysis  Consolidate financial activities such as forecasting and budgeting  Liaison between segments, countries, and HQ  Participate in special projects Factory And Cost Accounting Learn cost, inventory, product and project costing  Exposure to specific product lines and segments  Manage inventory tracking and reporting  Reconcile accounts and perform close activities Order And Contract Administration Support contract negotiations and proposal activities  Experience order entry and execution  Perform project controlling tasks Location:Based in Alpharetta, GA for first rotation; all other rotations have option to work remotely with flexibility to travel to manufacturing sites in Norwood, OH and New Kensington, PA. Program Start Date: July 2024 Your profile.We’re looking for people who are resourceful –true problem solvers who challenge themselves to find the most effective and efficient solutions to complex challenges and are not satisfied with business as usual. We provide a platform for those who want to have an impact on the future and to contribute to the successes of the company, our customers, and the world. Majors: Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or Management with an Accounting or Finance concentration  Graduation Date: Must graduate by the program start date of July 2024 , but no more than one year prior  Minimum GPA: 3.0  Relocation and Travel: Must be willing to relocate and travel as required by program  Work Authorization: Permanent work authorization in the U.S. is required The pay range for this position is $48,000 - $82,200. The actual wage offered may be lower or higher depending on budget and candidate experience, knowledge, skills, qualifications, and premium geographic location.What We Offer.At Innomotics, we are committed to an ownership culture, in which every employee takes personal responsibility for our company’s success. We apply lean principles and seek to continually improve our processes and customers’ experience.Why you’ll love working at #TeamInnomotics Competitive compensation based on qualifications  Medical, dental, prescription and vision coverage, first day of employment  Matching 401(k) (immediate employer match)  Competitive paid time off plan, paid holidays, and floating holidays  Career development opportunities  Education and tuition reimbursement programs available  Flexibility to work remote a few days a week  Paid parental leave Who designs your future? You do. Make your mark in our exciting world. #JoinReliableMotion #TeamInnomotics As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.Jobs at Innomotics  - if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Innomotics.Equal Employment Opportunity StatementSiemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.EEO is the LawApplicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination. To learn more, Click here .Pay Transparency Non-Discrimination ProvisionSiemens follows Executive Order 11246, including the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision. title: Risk Insurance Analyst- Real Estate Practice
job_description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  Customer and client expectations are constantly evolving. quotesFollow up with insurance brokers on open itemsMaintain insurance program registry and ensure all policies are received and storedProcesses and track department invoicesGather renewal data for Master builder’s risk and CPL insurance policiesAssist with the placement of portfolio-wide property and liability insurance programs and environmental coveragesManage the acquisition and disposition process related to risk managementWork with the company’s brokers and outside consultantsAssist asset managers and property managers with insurance-related requests, and provide risk assessment correspondence to the fieldParticipate in the property and liability loss control inspection processCollect, organize and prepare exposure information and data for analysisProvide quarterly and ad hoc reporting of insurance coverage informationSpecial projects as assignedWhat You Need To HaveMinimum 1 years’ experience in risk management, commercial insurance brokerages or insurance companiesDemonstrated knowledge of property and casualty insurance coverage requiredExperienced user of Microsoft Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPointWe’ll Count On You ToBe highly organizedAbility to multitask and prioritize competing demands; work effectively under pressureExcellent project management skillsExcellent oral and written communicationExcellent problem solving skills; must be proactive and think ahead to solve problemsStrong interpersonal skills; must be able to interface with all levels of internal personnel and with external clients and service providersExcellent analytical skills; must be detail-orientedAbility to work independently and as a team memberSuperior customer service and responsive to the needs of the client and the companyBA/BS, preferably in Risk Management, Business, Finance or AccountingWhat's in it for you?A company with a strong brand and strong results to matchCulture of internal mobility, collaboration and valued partnership with HR from the businessAccess to leaders, relevant volunteer and mentoring opportunities and interactions with counterparts in industry groups and client organizationsCompetitive pay (salary and performance bonus potential) and full benefits package – starting day one (medical, dental, vision, STI/LTI, life insurance, generous 401k match AND contribution)Flexible work opportunities for work/life balanceTuition Reimbursement plan per year and participation in our Employee Stock Purchase PlanMarsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk adviser.
